subject: Avoid KeyError in compute API TestVersions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 16:57:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/test_versions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/5c2ab33b2d915691031f6413a3e6bc6b56d95ce6', 'message': "Avoid KeyError in compute API TestVersions

If the response doesn't have a 'versions' key we
get a KeyError. It would be more useful to use
assertIn first because if that fails it will
dump the response in the error message.

Change-Id: I6c05ad377847e2b67ab988efdba006f73cbafcfe
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid KeyError in compute API TestVersions

If the response doesn't have a 'versions' key we
get a KeyError. It would be more useful to use
assertIn first because if that fails it will
dump the response in the error message.

Change-Id: I6c05ad377847e2b67ab988efdba006f73cbafcfe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/19/388119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIn('versions', result) self.assertIn('versions', result)

commit_message:
Add root-marker for Javascript projects

These two new jobs did not add the .root-marker that is needed for AFS
publishing. Add them.

Change-Id: I695a89e6aeb2e84f116b4c7dfdb966ad6ed3b3cf

subject: Fixes transparent binding to OpenDaylight in HA Proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 12:55:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/ddafa2afe65923c379a945606b7c56286b8a47b6', 'message': 'Fixes transparent binding to OpenDaylight in HA Proxy

ODL was missing transparent binding mode, which causes HA deployments to
fail since HA Proxy will try to come up on every node (even without
VIP).

Closes-Bug: 1637833

Change-Id: I0bb7839cdcfeacb4ca1a9fc6f878e8b51330be92
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8ee57d6b61c5d3951c147d159e42e12a1c354cfc)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes transparent binding to OpenDaylight in HA Proxy

ODL was missing transparent binding mode, which causes HA deployments to
fail since HA Proxy will try to come up on every node (even without
VIP).

Closes-Bug: 1637833

Change-Id: I0bb7839cdcfeacb4ca1a9fc6f878e8b51330be92
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8ee57d6b61c5d3951c147d159e42e12a1c354cfc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/42/392142/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "${opendaylight_api_vip}:8081" => $haproxy_listen_bind_param, "${public_virtual_ip}:8081" => $haproxy_listen_bind_param,

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: Idcf30eda54575add502d026fde22f5a90a93b991
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/09/387509/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os 'sphinxmark' watermark = os.popen("git branch --contains $(git rev-parse HEAD) | awk -F/ '/stable/ {print $2}'").read().strip(' \n\t').capitalize() if watermark == "": watermark = "Pre-release" # -- Options for sphinxmark ----------------------------------------------- sphinxmark_enable = True sphinxmark_div = 'docs-body' sphinxmark_image = 'text' sphinxmark_text = watermark sphinxmark_text_color = (128, 128, 128) sphinxmark_text_size = 70

commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

The release management team have indicated this is their preferred way
to collect release notes in future.

Closes-Bug: #1634356

Change-Id: Iabdf3aeaab725fcbbe21e49fd7f60211cb796b68

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-29 09:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/db/firewall/test_firewall_db.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/db/firewall/v2/test_firewall_db_v2.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/27f3bbc89a403300515883f79b6e9c94633b583c', 'message': 'Remove import of neutron.extensions

As I was evaluating the list of places where neutron is imported into
neutron-fwaas, this instance jumped out at me as an example of something
that was probably pulled in as part of a template once upon a time, and
is no longer necessary.  All tests succeed without it.

Change-Id: I752d801481295d8e0e36de31e93f519917289fe5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove import of neutron.extensions

As I was evaluating the list of places where neutron is imported into
neutron-fwaas, this instance jumped out at me as an example of something
that was probably pulled in as part of a template once upon a time, and
is no longer necessary.  All tests succeed without it.

Change-Id: I752d801481295d8e0e36de31e93f519917289fe5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/90/391590/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: extensions_path = ':'.join(extensions.__path__)

commit_message:
Dell SC: AsyncTask could return incomplete

If the asyncTask is bogus we log the whole structure.

If no url is included as a return value we attempt to
create it.

Closes-Bug: #1636554
Change-Id: I84f2859add3bf22d631b0310b42131c6d15f25e6
(cherry picked from commit 6599529f2b52de39ca55ce6755fb5df187425094)

commit_message:
Blueprint for making admin user optional

Change-Id: I01ead58027b7ab25cc1cb305ceb40768e7f3ff47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/67/381167/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/rally/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ===================================== Configurable Task Verification Levels ===================================== This spec proposes an update to the rally task verification process to allow users without an admin role to run scenarios that don't require an admin role. Problem description =================== Currently Rally verification requires admin user for all tasks, even those that do not actually require an admin. All validators will accept user and admin credentials and sometimes use them, sometimes not. This produces a lot of issues: * a user with admin role is required even to run benchmarks that don't require admin role * rally can't be used for non-OpenStack benchmarking * there is no way to make validation per tenant (in case of existing users) Proposed change =============== There are several changes needed to implement this change. First is to remove the requirement for an admin user: * update schema for deployments to remove admin as a required element (only existing?) Remove "admin" attribute from the list of required elemenents. * update deployment code to handle "admin" as optional Secondly, we need a way to mark a task as "requires-admin" since there are tasks which can't be run unless provided an admin user. This could be done in several ways: 1. add a new attribute to the task to indicate that it requires a user with admin role, then add code in the validation to handle this new attribute. 2. let the user find out themselves when they try to use a function that requires admin role and it fails with an error indicating that the user is not authorized. The benefit of the former is that it makes it clear that the author of the scenario is aware that it needs an admin user. The benefit of the latter is that no code changes are required, and changes to a task don't require removal of the attribute. Implementation ============== Implementation details ---------------------- The implementation of the first part (making admin user optional) is straightforward. It requires updating schemas to make admin an optional element (currently it is required). The implementation of the second part (marking a task as requiring admin) is more interesting. Depending on the approach taken this could either be no code change, or updates to task validation to detect and honor a new requires-admin attribute. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Steve Heyman <steve.heyman@rackspace.com> Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Check for configured groups in the environment

When defining a configuration, it's possible that the groups defined in
the openstack_user_config.yml file might not match those defined by the
env.d contents. This isn't strictly a problem - in most cases it's
ignored and will simply result in extra data. However, if keys in the
configuration and the environment are mismatched, it could result in
variable data not being mapped correctly in the resultant inventory.

This patchset extends the -c/--check parameter to compare the configured
groups against the environment's groups, and issue a warning if there is
a mismatch, which should help deployers diagnose some configuration
issues.

The warnings were not added to standard run operations due to the amount
of output generated on stdout by the JSON dump.

Change-Id: I7a7e52b31909e963873063e43e28a5bb9a6963fd

commit_message:
Fix response code for invalid requests

If in body of POST, PUT or PATCH requests there is
invalid json Sahara API reply with
500 "Internal Server Error" insted of
400 "Bad Request". In this commit I fix error code
and add error message to response.

Change-Id: I7ccf27e60c72e47e085690017e7eb19213930fdd
Closes-bug: #1632705

Improve parameters loading

Display loader for parameters only when parameters are not loaded
Invalidate parameters (set parameters as not loaded) when
environment configuration changes

commit_message:
Add an upper constraint to kombu in requirements.txt

Kombu 4.0 requires vine, which should be provided by amqp2.0 requirements.
But the requirements file specifies that amqp must be <2.0, causing vine
not to be installed. This is the reason for kombu's upper constraint.
You can find more details about this here:
https://github.com/celery/kombu/issues/641

Change-Id: Ida59357c43f3a4f1858feb8574860564dd543da3

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I71fb255c0d6b0e795d931c8ca2041446e3a77618
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-l2gw refs/changes/36/392036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
WIP - Use os-brick for encryption of volumes

The encryptor classes was copied into os-brick during Newton and should
now be used directly by Nova to format and access encrypted volumes.

Change-Id: Ic21fa8479e98d5fb1d350e10c61d5a24943c27af

commit_message:
Previous version of keystone reconfigure fails at adding fernet
components to fact variable "keystone_item".
Ansible can not create fact variable using newly created variable
in a same task.

This patch set split this task into two tasks, first create variable
containing fernet components, then merge it to "keystone_item".

(Change-Id for master: I15571ab20d6104d30350e8b922401b462336fca0)

Change-Id: I6d531297738e4c56d352f5d5baf97c361b92a161
Closes-Bug: #1636047

commit_message:
Constraints are ready to be used for tox.ini

Per email[1] from Andreas, we don't need to hack at install_command
any longer.

[1] http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/a4l7tokbotwqvuoh

Change-Id: I581cd94dd794ffb4d366a155e6d2bd8784809dd3
(cherry picked from commit 30453da9c95ea3ed1f80577eb38249ffa0dbcb50)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary debug logs of normal API ops

There are some debug log messages about normal API operations
in each API method, but Nova WSGI framework has already output
the similar messages. So these messages are meaningless, and
this patch removes them.

With Ifea3edd912ec80eed2869c3f97345d403ea96c89 , this work was
done once but the merger of servers.py retrieved this logs.

Change-Id: Ifef708ca4110bc91f8cf18e15bc8e22509606994

commit_message:
OpenStack typo

According to the word choice convention in
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/word-choice.html
We should use OpenStack instead of Openstack or openstack.

Change-Id: Ie05db63cafdf81ba4a38b9c1d3fae85848662c68

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated network range

The default network range was deprecated[1]. And so, it's more
appropriate that the reference deployment that this is doing should
have something that's actually valid and usable for people.

[1] I931a1f7160a007d367621de5cc1034c56c7741cf

Depends-On: Ic3aa434a0b314d5aa5f86b2d1d5fed73a30b8c9f@gerrithub

commit_message:
[config-ref] cleanup Dot Hill volume driver

Change-Id: I849ed3bd40ec93025bc0af3226869bbf4be05336
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/40/390840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Dot Hill AssuredSAN array with: - iSCSI or FC host interfaces - G22x firmware or later - Appropriate licenses for the snapshot and copy volume features - Network connectivity between the OpenStack host and the array management interfaces - HTTPS or HTTP must be enabled on the array- Create, delete, attach, and detach volumes. - Create, list, and delete volume snapshots. - Create a volume from a snapshot. - Copy an image to a volume. - Copy a volume to an image. - Clone a volume. - Extend a volume. - Migrate a volume with back-end assistance. - Retype a volume. - Manage and unmanage a volume. - The ``dothill_backend_name`` value specifies the name of the storage pool or vdisk on the array. - The ``volume_backend_name`` option value can be a unique value, if you wish to be able to assign volumes to a specific storage pool on the array, or a name that is shared among multiple storage pools to let the volume scheduler choose where new volumes are allocated. - The rest of the options will be repeated for each storage pool in a given array: the appropriate Cinder driver name; IP address or hostname of the array management interface; the username and password of an array user account with ``manage`` privileges; and the iSCSI IP addresses for the array if using the iSCSI transport protocol. [pool-a] dothill_backend_name = A volume_backend_name = dothill-array volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.dothill.dothill_iscsi.DotHillISCSIDriver san_ip = 10.1.2.3 san_login = manage san_password = !manage dothill_iscsi_ips = 10.2.3.4,10.2.3.5 [pool-b] dothill_backend_name = B volume_backend_name = dothill-array volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.dothill.dothill_iscsi.DotHillISCSIDriver san_ip = 10.1.2.3 san_login = manage san_password = !manage dothill_iscsi_ips = 10.2.3.4,10.2.3.5 [DEFAULT] ... enabled_backends = pool-a,pool-b default_volume_type = dothill ... $ openstack volume type create dothill $ openstack volume type set --property volume_backend_name=dothill-array dothill #. After modifying ``cinder.conf``, restart the ``cinder-volume`` service.
deleted_lines: - Dot Hill AssuredSAN array with: - iSCSI or FC host interfaces - G22x firmware or later - Appropriate licenses for the snapshot and copy volume features - Network connectivity between the OpenStack host and the array management interfaces - HTTPS or HTTP must be enabled on the array- Create, delete, attach, and detach volumes. - Create, list, and delete volume snapshots. - Create a volume from a snapshot. - Copy an image to a volume. - Copy a volume to an image. - Clone a volume. - Extend a volume. - Migrate a volume with back-end assistance. - Retype a volume. - Manage and unmanage a volume. - The ``dothill_backend_name`` value specifies the name of the storage pool or vdisk on the array. - The ``volume_backend_name`` option value can be a unique value, if you wish to be able to assign volumes to a specific storage pool on the array, or a name that is shared among multiple storage pools to let the volume scheduler choose where new volumes are allocated. - The rest of the options will be repeated for each storage pool in a given array: the appropriate Cinder driver name; IP address or hostname of the array management interface; the username and password of an array user account with ``manage`` privileges; and the iSCSI IP addresses for the array if using the iSCSI transport protocol. [pool-a] dothill_backend_name = A volume_backend_name = dothill-array volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.dothill.dothill_iscsi.DotHillISCSIDriver san_ip = 10.1.2.3 san_login = manage san_password = !manage dothill_iscsi_ips = 10.2.3.4,10.2.3.5 [pool-b] dothill_backend_name = B volume_backend_name = dothill-array volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.dothill.dothill_iscsi.DotHillISCSIDriver san_ip = 10.1.2.3 san_login = manage san_password = !manage dothill_iscsi_ips = 10.2.3.4,10.2.3.5 [DEFAULT] ... enabled_backends = pool-a,pool-b default_volume_type = dothill ... $ cinder type-create dothill $ cinder type-key dothill set volume_backend_name=dothill-array #. After modifying ``cinder.conf``, restart the cinder-volume service.

subject: Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 14:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/commit/6856459cd2bf751c399343bbcbf60e2f04894da7', 'message': 'Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 5dc67955f0ac08a7c9719d641e9828558620da89. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b
(cherry picked from commit 351dac725de3afd442455fadc755620a90522fca)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 5dc67955f0ac08a7c9719d641e9828558620da89. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b
(cherry picked from commit 351dac725de3afd442455fadc755620a90522fca)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/63/391863/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The cluster must be stopped when doing major/minor upgrades # http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading - name: Stop RabbitMQ nodes that are not the upgrader hosts: rabbitmq_all[1:] serial: 1 max_fail_percentage: 0 user: root tasks: - name: "Stop RabbitMQ" service: name: "rabbitmq-server" state: "stopped" when: rabbitmq_upgrade | default(false) | bool serial: 1
deleted_lines: # NOTE(mancdaz): rabbitmq cannot be upgraded in serial, so when # rabbitmq_upgrade=True, serial is set to 0, else it is 1 for installs serial: "{{ rabbitmq_upgrade|default(false) | bool | ternary(0, 1)}}"

  and specifically _not_ for how the plugin is used in OpenStack CI

  to run the 'test_server_basic_ops' test.

'check experimental' and usage of the forums for discussing
networking-calico changes.

Change-Id: I8623c068c0e1a42a2c44d7557e3f9b7dba4af810

commit_message:
Get a minimal OpenStack CI DevStack/Tempest test passing

This commit is a step towards comprehensive OpenStack CI testing that is
run automatically on every proposed networking-calico change.  As of
this commit, however:

- the testing is not automatic; it must be explicitly requested by
  leaving a 'check experimental' comment in Gerrit

- if the test fails for a particular change, it does not prevent that
  change from being merged; this is because we are not yet confident
  that the testing is always reliable

- the testing comprises a single Tempest test, 'test_server_basic_ops';
  we expect to expand this in further commits.

Some changes were needed to our DevStack plugin code, to allow it to
work in the OpenStack CI environment; all of these changes are also good
for the non-CI environments that we already test in.

- pip_install core Calico code instead of using git_clone.  (OpenStack
  CI jobs aren't allowed to use git clone.)

- Don't do a compute-only install when SERVICE_HOST is
  127.0.0.1.  (OpenStack CI sets SERVICE_HOST to 127.0.0.1.)

- Move 'disable_service tempest' and
  'NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS=False' from plugin settings to the
  wider bootstrap script.  These settings are appropriate for a basic
  Calico demonstration (which is what the bootstrap script does) but
  _not_ for all possible uses of the networking-calico DevStack plugin,
  and specifically _not_ for how the plugin is used in OpenStack CI
  testing.

- Copy devstackgaterc file from networking-ovn, then modify so as only
  to run the 'test_server_basic_ops' test.

This commit also improves the doc about contributing, to recommend
'check experimental' and usage of the forums for discussing
networking-calico changes.

Change-Id: I8623c068c0e1a42a2c44d7557e3f9b7dba4af810
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/63/339263/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip_install git+https://github.com/projectcalico/calico.git@${CALICO_BRANCH:-master}#egg=calico

commit_message:
Remove warnings for dropped context arguments

This patch removes the warning messages for dropped arguments upon
context setup. They are of limited use and dropping them should
increase the readability of the logs.

Change-Id: I8003dd576a575be4d87e69ef5459009eeb15fabe
Closes-Bug: #1607444

commit_message:
Updated envd configs for mixed virt and baremetal (ironic)

The env.d files and example configs have been updated to show how ironic
can be mixed with virt within the same control plane. These files allow
for a new group ironic-compute_hosts to be setup. This will spawn a new
ironic container on the selected node which will contain the
nova-compute and nova-scheduler service configured for use within
ironic.

The test cases have been updated to support the new ironic_compute
environmental group.

Change-Id: Iaa467e28fd829722384cb2e8dad2ed7bf08484e5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Networking guide correction on provider networks creation

Networking guide mentions, that provider networks can be created only by
admin users. This is not true as policy.json controls which user can
create a provider network.

Change-Id: I25d516dd1597b3d032bdebb141f3d8ea87e10490
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

Fixed escaping of \. in seed/upgrade-db graph

Python's YAML parser failed to parse this file
due to the unknown escape symbol.

Change-Id: I1ec3d0752bb6ee6f09e5cf47bf01a55f60dd7926

commit_message:
Raise exception in command "plugin configs get"

In this patch, there are three changes.
1. Raise Exception if the config file already exists.
2. Avoid overriding the file of different version of a plugin.
3. stdout message should end with '\n' to start a newline.
4. execute remote API call only when file not exists.

Change-Id: I0c9eb2cb7fd1cafe4bea05c73811d6dea6b3e9a8
Closes-Bug: 1625990

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-16 15:26:21.000000000', 'files': ['tools/config/config-generator.sahara.conf', 'etc/sahara/api-paste.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/c0f43c2c5f6bd21d258063cb0559daf90c960412', 'message': 'Use http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Sahara.
The purpose of this middleware is to set up the request URL
correctly in case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer
such as HAProxy) in front of Sahara.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled
via a configuration value.

Change-Id: Ica7e8671e3880c0db90d382bec89b0994f75b36d
Closes-bug: #1590608
'}]
commit_message:
Use http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Sahara.
The purpose of this middleware is to set up the request URL
correctly in case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer
such as HAProxy) in front of Sahara.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled
via a configuration value.

Change-Id: Ica7e8671e3880c0db90d382bec89b0994f75b36d
Closes-bug: #1590608
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/77/387077/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pipeline = cors http_proxy_to_wsgi request_id acl auth_validator sahara_api [filter:http_proxy_to_wsgi] paste.filter_factory = oslo_middleware:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory
deleted_lines: pipeline = cors request_id acl auth_validator sahara_api

commit_message:
Disable Ubuntu UCA release.

We are not support UCA as OpenStack release anymore.
Switch UCA to manageonly to remove it from install
options.
Create alembic migration to change state in 9.2
and change openstack.yaml in case someone redeploy
over puppet

Change-Id: Ib09b52f4213502f678548f847483ab79b91751fe
Closes-Bug: #1632131
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/87/391887/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: state: "manageonly"

commit_message:
cors: update default configuration using cors' own set_defaults funtion

set_fefaults has been added into oslo_middleware. so we use to
override the configuration defaults.

Change-Id: I6c069de6f7a03af0a54631c87d3e467683d0ddae

commit_message:
Account for Infiniband GID when validating an address

This patch is extending the address validation to support an Infiniband
GIDs. Without this, when a Infiniband NIC is present and IPA tries to
lookup for the node booting the Ironic API will fail validation and the
deployment won't succeed.

The method validate_and_normalize_mac() from the common/utils.py module
has been renamed to validate_and_normalize_address() to better reflect
what it's doing.

Closes-Bug: #1633585
Change-Id: Ia0eeed79db217ea79830791acfa756cd638d4abd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/59/387559/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_valid_address(address): """Verify the format of an address. Check if it's a valid MAC address (6 octets) or an Infiniband GID (20 octets). Accepts colon-separated format only. g = "[0-9a-f]{2}(:[0-9a-f]{2}){19}$" if not isinstance(address, six.string_types): return False address = address.lower() return re.match(m, address) or re.match(g, address)def validate_and_normalize_address(address): """Validate an address and return normalized form. Checks whether the supplied MAC address is formally correct (6 octets) or a valid Infiniband GID (20 octets) and normalize it to all lower case. if not is_valid_address(address):
deleted_lines: def is_valid_mac(address): """Verify the format of a MAC address. Check if a MAC address is valid and contains six octets. Accepts colon-separated format only. return (isinstance(address, six.string_types) and re.match(m, address.lower()))def validate_and_normalize_mac(address): """Validate a MAC address and return normalized form. Checks whether the supplied MAC address is formally correct and normalize it to all lower case. if not is_valid_mac(address):

commit_message:
Updates amphora element to use stable/mitaka agent

The amphora-agent diskimage-builder element currently pulls from
master.  This patch will cause the agent installed in the amphora
to pull from the stable/mitaka branch.

Change-Id: I52621e734c4d15cba780f263d666d5291854a1b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/63/391063/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

list.

commit_message:
Add .chomp to a system output operation

In the _get_pci_dev_list method adding .chomp is needed to the
`cat /etc/nailgun_systemtype` operation in order to make a correct
comparison with 'bootstrap' string.

Change-Id: Id2fdc4c7b7bd7604c43803da594480bf865cf1cb
Related-Bug: #1554970
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent refs/changes/98/391898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return {} if `cat /etc/nailgun_systemtype`.chomp != 'bootstrap'

Add reno for release notes management

The release management team have indicated this is their preferred way
to collect release notes in future.

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Replacing 'GB' with 'GiB'.

Reasons: - The storage unit should be Gibibytes(Gib)
rather than Gigabytes(GB).

Changes: - Changed 'GB' with 'GiB' in doc strings of
different modules of python-novaclient.

Change-Id: I46ee63b0f751676371956473736a0735f10d7cd5
Closes-Bug: #1516848

Change-Id: I04f842575de0d389ca16978554d0cd7b11052200

commit_message:
Updates amphora element to use stable/newton agent

The amphora-agent diskimage-builder element currently pulls from
master.  This patch will cause the agent installed in the amphora
to pull from the stable/newton branch.

Change-Id: I04f842575de0d389ca16978554d0cd7b11052200
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/66/391066/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
rest: register default JSON converter using pecan.jsonify

This has the upside of making sure that this is used when encoding
errors too, not only regular output.

Change-Id: I8f311bde8f285675a029d44bbffa7d5e720a39eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/52/391452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright © 2014-2016 eNovancefrom pecan import jsonify# Register our encoder by default for everything jsonify.jsonify.register(object)(json.to_primitive)
deleted_lines: # Copyright © 2014-2015 eNovanceclass OsloJSONRenderer(object): @staticmethod def __init__(*args, **kwargs): pass @staticmethod def render(template_path, namespace): return json.dumps(namespace) custom_renderers={'json': OsloJSONRenderer},

commit_message:
Store user settings cookie data with UID

User settings stored in session and cookie were non-user specific,
by using the user's id as the cookie key and storing a JSON object,
we can access these settings on a per-user basis.

Change-Id: Id5f2c360eb9dafdd36385ae595f6ee773c6aad34
Closes-Bug: 1363188
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/34/118334/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: usr_id = request.session.get('user_id') tz_key = "%s_django_timezone" % usr_id tz = request.session.get(tz_key)

subject: Fixed labeling issues on VPN Service Details page
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-30 21:09:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e8c142103ee2314d0132c2368b8921d6d34bd2ab', 'message': 'Fixed labeling issues on VPN Service Details page

On the VPN Service Details page, there are a few labels that are
confusing and useless to the user.  This change proposes the
following fixes to improve the user experience on this page:

- The "Router ID" label is currently showing the router name, not
the ID.  This label should be changed to just "Router", since the
value for this label is a link to the details for the entire router
resource.

- The "Subnet ID" label is currently showing the subnet name + address,
not the ID.  This label should also be changed to "Subnet".

- The "Project ID" label should also be changed to "Project".
As a result of this, the "Project ID" value should be changed to show
the name of the project, as it is currently displaying the ID.
The ID is useless to the average user.

- Each name value for the above mentioned fields should be a link
to that item's details page.  If the user really wants to see the ID,
they can view the details page for more info.  Specifically, this
pertains to the new "Project" label.  The corresponding name of
the project should be a link.

Change-Id: I856bf4ecaf25020391aca876c3392d8a2e35e829
Closes-Bug: #1500586
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-30 21:13:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/0c30e1a11ed17f5ee31f7100ba30a92417377a55', 'message': 'Fixed labeling issues on VPN Service Details page

On the VPN Service Details page, there are a few labels that are

- The "Router ID" label is currently showing the router name, not

value for this label is a link to the details for the entire router
resource.

- The "Subnet ID" label is currently showing the subnet name + address,
not the ID.  This label should also be changed to "Subnet".

- The "Project ID" label should also be changed to "Project".
As a result of this, the "Project ID" value should be changed to show
the name of the project, as it is currently displaying the ID.
The ID is useless to the average user.

- Each name value for the above mentioned fields should be a link
to that item's details page.  If the user really wants to see the ID,
they can view the details page for more info.  Specifically, this
pertains to the new "Project" label.  The corresponding name of
the project should be a link.

Change-Id: I856bf4ecaf25020391aca876c3392d8a2e35e829
Closes-Bug: #1500586
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-30 21:14:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6f605f874ebec6a4d888ea6b90b1d79e84fd10ce', 'message': 'Fixed labeling issues on VPN Service Details page

On the VPN Service Details page, there are a few labels that are
confusing and useless to the user.  This change proposes the
following fixes to improve the user experience on this page:

- The "Router ID" label is currently showing the router name, not
the ID.  This label should be changed to just "Router", since the
value for this label is a link to the details for the entire router
resource.

- The "Subnet ID" label is currently showing the subnet name + address,
not the ID.  This label should also be changed to "Subnet".

- The "Project ID" label should also be changed to "Project".
As a result of this, the "Project ID" value should be changed to show
the name of the project, as it is currently displaying the ID.
The ID is useless to the average user.

- Each name value for the above mentioned fields should be a link
to that item's details page.  If the user really wants to see the ID,
they can view the details page for more info.  Specifically, this
pertains to the new "Project" label.  The corresponding name of
the project should be a link.

On the VPN Service Details page, there are a few labels that are
confusing and useless to the user.  This change proposes the
following fixes to improve the user experience on this page:

- To match the other fields, the "Project ID" value should be changed
to show the name of the project, as it is currently displaying the ID.
This value should also be a link to the details page of that project.
This will be way more useful to the user then just displaying the ID.
The ID alone is useless to the average user.  If they really want to
see the ID, that is what the details page is for.  Hence the need for
a quick link.

- All "XXXXX ID" labels should be changed to just "XXXXX".  That is,
"Project ID" should be changed to "Project", "Router ID" to "Router",
and "Subnet ID" to "Subnet".  Being that the values of these label
fields are links to the entire details of that item, it makes more
sense to remove the "ID" and reference it as the whole item.

- In order to get the project details (i.e. project name), a keystone
API call was required.  To prevent a user that does not have access
to these details from being unexpectedly logged off upon clicking the
project name link, a policy check was set in place that basically
only implements the new code if the user does indeed have access to
these details.

Closes-Bug: #1500586

commit_message:
Fixed labeling issues on VPN Service Details page

On the VPN Service Details page, there are a few labels that are
confusing and useless to the user.  This change proposes the
following fixes to improve the user experience on this page:

- To match the other fields, the "Project ID" value should be changed
to show the name of the project, as it is currently displaying the ID.
This value should also be a link to the details page of that project.
This will be way more useful to the user then just displaying the ID.
The ID alone is useless to the average user.  If they really want to
see the ID, that is what the details page is for.  Hence the need for
a quick link.

- All "XXXXX ID" labels should be changed to just "XXXXX".  That is,
"Project ID" should be changed to "Project", "Router ID" to "Router",
and "Subnet ID" to "Subnet".  Being that the values of these label
fields are links to the entire details of that item, it makes more
sense to remove the "ID" and reference it as the whole item.

- In order to get the project details (i.e. project name), a keystone
API call was required.  To prevent a user that does not have access
to these details from being unexpectedly logged off upon clicking the
project name link, a policy check was set in place that basically
only implements the new code if the user does indeed have access to
these details.

Change-Id: I856bf4ecaf25020391aca876c3392d8a2e35e829
Closes-Bug: #1500586

{% trans "Router" %}
{% trans "Subnet" %}
deleted_lines: <dt>{% trans "Project ID" %}</dt> <dd>{{ vpnservice.tenant_id }}</dd> <dt>{% trans "Router ID" %}</dt> <dt>{% trans "Subnet ID" %}</dt>

commit_message:
Sort settings by weight AND label attributes

Sort settings by weight attribute,
then by label if weight is undefined or not unique.

Related to blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

Change-Id: I58e57d2045577d42b5da28646837a558335665d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/57/391857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: var sortedSettings = _.sortBy(settingsToDisplay, (settingName) => { var {weight, label} = section[settingName]; return [weight, label]; });

commit_message:
Enable TLS in the internal network for cinder-api

This optionally enables TLS for cinder-api  in the internal network.
If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the keystone
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I7d8c31afa66fbd3dd630b64aa6447f0d4ffbdf93

commit_message:
Only show stable repositories in upgrade guide

There's a bunch of text related to bleeding edge trunk repos which
confuses the upgrade guide. Extract the stable repos part of
repositories.txt into repositories_stable.txt and only include the
stable repos in upgrade guide.

Change-Id: I6cf90873c3f2fccb34d09d241ca053850fe32aff

commit_message:
Add replacepkgs to the manual ovs upgrade workaround and fix a typo

rpm command will return an exit 1 if ovs package is already
there and will exit the step_1.sh script. To get around this
force the update with --replacepkgs

Also remove the \ just before the $ which cause a syntax
error for the ceph storage

Change-Id: I11fcf688982ceda5eef7afc8904afae44300c2d9
Closes-bug: 1636748
(cherry picked from commit 61cba946cd11ab3a2d6518663f2300d7c98083de)

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 02:03:26.000000000', 'files': ['devops/helpers/ssh_client.py', 'devops/helpers/exec_result.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops/commit/2f1ad5a3e0423a021013a1c81fd2da4cb0490f8f', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I6fad4a54e2ed1199da44ac66eaf133d728f49aec
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I6fad4a54e2ed1199da44ac66eaf133d728f49aec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/17/387117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
Pop name from volume.base.create_server

In volume.base.create_server, name argument should be popped out from
kwargs, otherwise the call to create_server(name='xxx') will raise
"TypeError: create_test_server() got multiple values for keyword
argument 'name'"

Change-Id: I837443a2c028692db512a017aed11d3dad21c799

commit_message:
Only emit deprecation warning when deprecated value read

If providers is not found in the CONF.service_providers.service_provider
it looks them up from implicit conf files. If nothing is defined there
it still emits a deprecation warning.

Maybe a warning should be emitted if this value is empty, however the
deprecation warning that is provided is incorrect and misleading.

Change-Id: I3166a445b69d854b294843814a081e74c1aadb3b
Closes-Bug: #1633293
(cherry picked from commit 46ba1aa762737daee26e35a45eaa87e3a427521a)

commit_message:
Keepalived global_defs configuration entries required to avoid DNS lookup

This changeset addresses a particular L3-HA Neutron deployment scenario
in which the DNS server configured for the management network is not
also accessible from the virtual router namespace (i.e. over the
external network).
Keepalived uses the hostname against getaddrinfo twice to set default
values for the router_id and notification_email_from global configuration
attributes. If the hostname cannot be resolved through /etc/hosts and
if the nameserver is not reachable, long delays are incurred during
keepalived startup and configuration reload, causing VRRP state flapping
and dropped traffic over floating IPs.

Setting router_id and notification_email_from in the keepalived
configuration avoids unnecessary DNS lookups. However, this solution
is only effective with keepalived >= 1.2.17. Older versions still
exhibit the same problem with or without this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1511722
Change-Id: If6e31d164bd6ade52997bc0073ef50cdbc99ec93
(cherry picked from commit b3af52e7388423a5fd3872453512218b00a5c6d7)

subject: Remove recursion from import_modules_recursively
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-22 15:08:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/tests/example/dir/subdir/__init__.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/tests/example/dir/subdir/example_module.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ec0e5d3bf434e7e409196c79f42a1fc92ce7ca96', 'message': 'Remove recursion from import_modules_recursively

Since the function already uses os.walk that will iterate through all
subdirectories for us, there is no need to recursively call the
function.

The recursive call was not just redundant, but also had another problem,
where we were passing relative paths to subdirectories, which made the
function to attempt importing modules that are not located under the
topdir. It could crash, or, worse, import a module that is
not under the expected parent directory.

This patch also modifies an existing unit test for the function to
validate that modules from subdirectories are also imported, even
without the recursive call.

Change-Id: I8b3a844460e4987b8a8375b01353d01e57d91604
Closes-Bug: #1634735
(cherry picked from commit 676257cea09b736328caacc61182e27d369e254b)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove recursion from import_modules_recursively

Since the function already uses os.walk that will iterate through all
subdirectories for us, there is no need to recursively call the
function.

The recursive call was not just redundant, but also had another problem,
where we were passing relative paths to subdirectories, which made the
function to attempt importing modules that are not located under the
topdir. It could crash, or, worse, import a module that is
not under the expected parent directory.

This patch also modifies an existing unit test for the function to
validate that modules from subdirectories are also imported, even
without the recursive call.

Change-Id: I8b3a844460e4987b8a8375b01353d01e57d91604
Closes-Bug: #1634735
(cherry picked from commit 676257cea09b736328caacc61182e27d369e254b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/390012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_recursion(self): expected_modules = ( 'neutron.tests.unit.tests.example.dir.example_module', 'neutron.tests.unit.tests.example.dir.subdir.example_module', ) for module in expected_modules: sys.modules.pop(module, None) for module in expected_modules: self.assertIn(module, modules) self.assertIn(module, sys.modules)
deleted_lines: def test_object_modules(self): example_module = 'neutron.tests.unit.tests.example.dir.example_module' sys.modules.pop(example_module, None) self.assertIn(example_module, modules) self.assertIn(example_module, sys.modules)

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: tripleo::profile::base::barbican::api # # Barbican profile for tripleo api # # === Parameters # # [*bootstrap_node*] # (Optional) The hostname of the node responsible for bootstrapping tasks # Defaults to hiera('bootstrap_nodeid') # # [*step*] # (Optional) The current step in deployment. See tripleo-heat-templates # for more details. # Defaults to hiera('step') class tripleo::profile::base::barbican::api ( $bootstrap_node = hiera('bootstrap_nodeid', undef), $step = hiera('step'), ) { if $::hostname == downcase($bootstrap_node) { $sync_db = true } else { $sync_db = false } include ::tripleo::profile::base::barbican if $step >= 3 and $sync_db { include ::barbican::db::mysql include ::barbican::db::sync } if $step >= 4 { include ::barbican include ::barbican::api include ::barbican::keystone::notification include ::barbican::quota include ::barbican::wsgi::apache } }

commit_message:
Fixes transparent binding to OpenDaylight in HA Proxy

ODL was missing transparent binding mode, which causes HA deployments to
fail since HA Proxy will try to come up on every node (even without
VIP).

Closes-Bug: 1637833

Change-Id: I0bb7839cdcfeacb4ca1a9fc6f878e8b51330be92
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/60/391660/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove RedHat grub workaround install

AFAICT this is no longer necessary.  I've tested minimal and image
builds and they seem to work.

The original problem seems to be with installing the package in the
chroot, although it was never quite clear it ever affected the Red Hat
path.

This code is currently broken (see
I884cb1e78ad8c31d985f3fc94a58091b993edd7d).  This is proposed as an
alternative to I74eed074494134334d5e49042bb5214bd0dd7339.

Related-Bug: #1627000

Change-Id: Iafe3611f4eec3c6357587a6cae6a30a261686ead

commit_message:
Expose add botton when text_list is empty

The issue is that when a text_list is empty
there is nothing to render including 'add'
and 'delete' buttons. We should provide the
possibility to add items when the list is empty.

Change-Id: I991ec3a885a6462f4a8afd7f96591fd7ec82a0b4
Closes-Bug: #1613614
(cherry picked from commit bb6b3605b508e5caf68ef2d6c90bb0c94be98e62)

commit_message:
Don't hang with wsgiref

This change adds a workaround to not hangs with certain
wsgi server when we read the body.

Change-Id: I512041231a03308c61a98cf626fdc4c074ea3564
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/67/391067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(sileht): We prefer use seekable if possible because it takes # care of Content-Length when you use read()/readlines(). # webob and wsgiref people are both well following RFCs, but sometimes # their are case when the application can hang, because read is waiting # for new data even the content-length is reach when keepalive # connection are used. For more detail see: # https://bugs.python.org/issue21878 # https://github.com/Pylons/webob/issues/279 if pecan.request.is_body_seekable: params = json.load(pecan.request.body_file_seekable) else: params = json.load(pecan.request.body_file_raw)

commit_message:
Re-add NFS backend for Glance

We lost ability to store Glance images in NFS mounts as we moved to NG
HA architecture. This patch re-adds that ability, but the parameter
interface changes because the semantics change as well. (Pacemaker
allowed for different mounts than just NFS so the parameters were more
generic, although we only ever tested and documented NFS usage.)

Change-Id: Ic5197e09846bbf75d780dcc74da1717dcf8301d0
Related-Bug: #1635606

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Remove default=None when set value in Config

By default oslo.cfg sets the default values as None [1], There is
no need to explicitly do this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L829

Change-Id: Ia91d058a2ba434755ff77fc3162c046fbf0776fd

subject: RH grub: don't fail if grub is already installed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 09:09:58.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/pre-install.d/15-remove-grub'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/acdd426bcc2561f5e388211cacc78a3d14a00c1d', 'message': "RH grub: don't fail if grub is already installed

It's been reported [1] that previous RHEL grub installation fix [2]
breaks image building for some centos/fedora use cases, because the grub
packages are already present and `rpm -i` then fails. Use
`--replacepkgs` in the installation to cover these cases.

[1] I884cb1e78ad8c31d985f3fc94a58091b993edd7d
[2] Iefd9c17fffd43de3fea260510ad218b1322eecb3

Change-Id: I74eed074494134334d5e49042bb5214bd0dd7339
Related-Bug: #1627000
"}]
commit_message:
RH grub: don't fail if grub is already installed

It's been reported [1] that previous RHEL grub installation fix [2]
breaks image building for some centos/fedora use cases, because the grub
packages are already present and `rpm -i` then fails. Use
`--replacepkgs` in the installation to cover these cases.

[1] I884cb1e78ad8c31d985f3fc94a58091b993edd7d
[2] Iefd9c17fffd43de3fea260510ad218b1322eecb3

Change-Id: I74eed074494134334d5e49042bb5214bd0dd7339
Related-Bug: #1627000
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/67/388567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "rpm -i --replacepkgs /tmp/grub/*.rpm" > /tmp/grub/install

commit_message:
deprecate external_network_bridge option in neutron

Option "external_network_bridge" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated
for removal. Its value may be silently ignored in the future.

Change-Id: I2752fca275dd7b340c0ff97bfa3eecc0d3358e63
Closes-Bug: #1637808

commit_message:
Add bindep environment to tox

This is helpful for listing any missing system requirements [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements

Change-Id: I54e3955ff0befae35eb1aada478023fa00afc5e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/13/391613/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:bindep] # Do not install any requirements. We want this to be fast and work even if # system dependencies are missing, since it's used to tell you what system # dependencies are missing! This also means that bindep must be installed # separately, outside of the requirements files, and develop mode disabled # explicitly to avoid unnecessarily installing the checked-out repo too (this # further relies on "tox.skipsdist = True" above). deps = bindep commands = bindep test usedevelop = False

commit_message:
change "openstack" to "OpenStack"

According to the word choice convention in
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/word-choice.html
We should use OpenStack instead of openstack.

Change-Id: I3023b606d30f112296025f67d7bbe25c49fa2f41
TrivialFix

commit_message:
Adds warning when no domain configs were uploaded

The 'keystone-manage domain_config_upload --all' previously didn't tell
the admin that there wasn't any files to upload. This means it was
possible for them to have put their configs in the wrong directory and
not know it.

Change-Id: Ib9ace1cc9654d4a32c9110eb5452c895605caf95
Closes-bug: #1472059

added_lines: import loggingimport fixturesimport oslo_config.fixture from oslotest import mockpatchfrom testtools import matchers class CliDomainConfigUploadNothing(tests.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(CliDomainConfigUploadNothing, self).setUp() config_fixture = self.useFixture(oslo_config.fixture.Config(CONF)) config_fixture.register_cli_opt(cli.command_opt) # NOTE(dstanek): since this is not testing any database # functionality there is no need to go through the motions and # setup a test database. def fake_load_backends(self): self.resource_manager = mock.Mock() self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject( cli.DomainConfigUploadFiles, 'load_backends', fake_load_backends)) self.logging = self.useFixture( fixtures.FakeLogger(level=logging.DEBUG)) def test_uploading_all_from_an_empty_directory_fails(self): CONF(args=['domain_config_upload', '--all'], project='keystone', default_config_files=[]) cli.DomainConfigUpload.main() expected_msg = ('No domain configs found in %r' % CONF.identity.domain_config_dir) self.assertThat(self.logging.output, matchers.Contains(expected_msg))

commit_message:
VXLAN support for OVS-DPDK

* restriction for using DPDK in VXLAN based
  segmentation case was removed
* in case of using VXLAN with DDPDK used 'br-mesh'
  bridge that has configuration as 'br-prv' and
  vendor specific attribute 'vlan_id' was added
  for 'add-br'
* appropriate tests were added

Implements blueprint vxlan-support-for-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: I1c4978a15df6f851339a346fe6c4812c5427dd29
(cherry picked from commit c592212a70744e2c2545e67945424ed0d5a3b765)

commit_message:
Remove indentation from l3_agent.ini.j2

If enable_neutron_dvr is set, it leads to a failure of the
'Copying over l3_agent.ini' task due to parsing errors.

TrivialFix
Closes-bug: #1633488

Change-Id: Ia30970d65cf7b09fff336fe878d2be02e934b082
(cherry picked from commit cd968665eb88124a199b3a2afd12c990703d38bd)

added_lines: from murano_plugin_tests import settings def apply_maintenance_update_90_to_91(self): """Method applies maintenance updates on whole cluster from MOS9.0 to MOS9.1 1) Add latest proposed repository 2) Import PGP key for installed repository 3) Install `python-cudet` 4) Add repository and deploy changes 5) Update with keys all nodes 6) Update-prepare prepare master 7) Update-prepare update master 8) Update-prepare prepare env 9) Update 10) Verify that you have the latest packages included in Mirantis OpenStack 9.1 - Potential updates: ALL NODES UP-TO-DATE """ logger.info("Add latest proposed repository") timestamp = self.get_last_timestamp(settings.CENTOS_REPO_URL) self.add_centos_test_proposed_repo(settings.CENTOS_REPO_URL, timestamp) self.install_python_cudet() self.prepare_update_master_node() self.prepare_for_update()

subject: Swift proxy performance fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 12:22:48.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift/commit/621c821867ac1cd42dd40871d03c853536551728', 'message': 'Swift proxy performance fixes

Performance testing of an OSA deployed Swift cluster hit several issues.
Comparison of the proxy conf with the Swift Auth doc [1] found
two settings that affect performance that that were not set in the template.

include_service_catalog - This defaults to True which makes the proxy server
fetch the service catalog on every request in the authtoken middleware. This
hammers Keystone.

cache - When using memcache this should be set so the authtoken middleware
uses the correct cache and not go back to Keystone on every request.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_auth.html

Change-Id: Iddaf097e3ff5c1b7118b11cfc598a40a91d6f96f
(cherry picked from commit b0f330e7b2a805c87a988d1cd312ec766e5e9f39)
'}]
commit_message:
Swift proxy performance fixes

Performance testing of an OSA deployed Swift cluster hit several issues.
Comparison of the proxy conf with the Swift Auth doc [1] found
two settings that affect performance that that were not set in the template.

include_service_catalog - This defaults to True which makes the proxy server
fetch the service catalog on every request in the authtoken middleware. This
hammers Keystone.

cache - When using memcache this should be set so the authtoken middleware
uses the correct cache and not go back to Keystone on every request.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_auth.html

Change-Id: Iddaf097e3ff5c1b7118b11cfc598a40a91d6f96f
(cherry picked from commit b0f330e7b2a805c87a988d1cd312ec766e5e9f39)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/09/391809/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include_service_catalog = Falsecache = swift.cache

commit_message:
NFS mounting for Glance file backend

Previously we did this with Pacemaker, but with move to NG HA
architecture we lost the ability to use NFS mounts as image storage for
Glance. This reimplements the mounting without utilizing Pacemaker. The
mount is by default also written to /etc/fstab so that it persists over
reboot, but this behavior can be disabled.

This could also go to puppet-glance eventually, but not yet -- we need
this backported to Newton because it's a TripleO regression. I don't
think puppet-glance would allow backporting this to Newton, because from
their point of view it would be a RFE rather than a regression.

Change-Id: I45ad34c36587a8d695069368cf791f1efb68256c
Related-Bug: #1635606

subject: lb: avoid doing nova VIF work plumbing tap to qbr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-23 20:52:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/eb61b837f70906aea07e4fd2290afa24f1341da8', 'message': "lb: avoid doing nova VIF work plumbing tap to qbr

neutron should rely on nova doing the job instead of trying to 'fix' it.
'Fixing' it introduces race conditions between lb agent and nova VIF
driver. Particularly, lb agent can scan for new tap devices in the
middle of nova plumbing qbr-tap setup, and attempt to do it on its own.
So if agent is more lucky to plug the tap device into the bridge, nova
may fail to do the same, getting the following error:

libvirtError: Unable to add bridge brqxxx-xx port tapxxx-xx: Device or
resource busy

This also requires a change in how the port admin_state_up is implemented
by setting the tap device's link state instead of moving it in or out
of the bridge.

Conflicts:
	neutron/common/constants.py
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darragh O'Reilly <darragh.oreilly@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Scheuring <andreas.scheuring@de.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I02971103407b4ec11a65218e9ef7e2708915d938
Closes-Bug: #1312016
(cherry picked from commit f42ea67995537c7fe3e36447489872b0dcb82dd9)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-24 08:03:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/64c3d359259270bbafc07ae4baccf36a945b7a24', 'message': 'lb: avoid doing nova VIF work plumbing tap to qbr

neutron should rely on nova doing the job instead of trying to 'fix' it.
'Fixing' it introduces race conditions between lb agent and nova VIF
driver. Particularly, lb agent can scan for new tap devices in the
middle of nova plumbing qbr-tap setup, and attempt to do it on its own.
So if agent is more lucky to plug the tap device into the bridge, nova
may fail to do the same, getting the following error:

libvirtError: Unable to add bridge brqxxx-xx port tapxxx-xx: Device or
resource busy

This also requires a change in how the port admin_state_up is implemented
by setting the tap device's link state instead of moving it in or out
of the bridge.

	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

"ValueError: unsupported format character 'a' (0x61) at index 90

Also squashed in:

The linux bridge agent was calling ensure_port_admin state
unconditionally on ports in treat_devices_added_or_updated.
This would cause it to throw an error on interfaces that
didn't exist so it would restart the entire processing loop.

If another port was being updated in the same loop before this
one, that port would experience a port status life-cycle of
DOWN->BUILD->ACTIVE->BUILD->ACTIVE

                          to start over again.

This causes the bug below because the first active transition will
cause Nova to boot the VM. At this point tempest tests expect the
ports that belong to the VM to be in the ACTIVE state so it filters
Neutron port list calls with "status=ACTIVE". Therefore tempest would
not get any ports back and assume there was some kind of error with
the port and bail.

This patch just makes sure the admin state call is skipped if the port
doesn't exist and it includes a basic unit test to prevent a regression.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

Closes-Bug: #1523638

commit_message:
lb: avoid doing nova VIF work plumbing tap to qbr

neutron should rely on nova doing the job instead of trying to 'fix' it.
'Fixing' it introduces race conditions between lb agent and nova VIF
driver. Particularly, lb agent can scan for new tap devices in the
middle of nova plumbing qbr-tap setup, and attempt to do it on its own.
So if agent is more lucky to plug the tap device into the bridge, nova
may fail to do the same, getting the following error:

libvirtError: Unable to add bridge brqxxx-xx port tapxxx-xx: Device or
resource busy

This also requires a change in how the port admin_state_up is implemented
by setting the tap device's link state instead of moving it in or out
of the bridge.

Conflicts:
	neutron/common/constants.py
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darragh O'Reilly <darragh.oreilly@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Scheuring <andreas.scheuring@de.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1312016
(cherry picked from commit f42ea67995537c7fe3e36447489872b0dcb82dd9)

===

Also squashed in the following follow up fix:

lb: Correct String formatting to get rid of logged ValueError

The following error is caused by a missing String formatting in the
linuxbridge agent:
"ValueError: unsupported format character 'a' (0x61) at index 90
Logged from file linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py, line 447"

In addition a duplicated word in the log text has been fixed.

Change-Id: I587f1165fc7084dc9c4806149b65652f6e27b14e
(cherry picked from commit 1f86d8687b2781f0c287ee656f3cbc65aaa4b5e4)

===

Also squashed in:

Only ensure admin state on ports that exist

The linux bridge agent was calling ensure_port_admin state
unconditionally on ports in treat_devices_added_or_updated.
This would cause it to throw an error on interfaces that
didn't exist so it would restart the entire processing loop.

If another port was being updated in the same loop before this
one, that port would experience a port status life-cycle of
DOWN->BUILD->ACTIVE->BUILD->ACTIVE
                   ^ <--- Exception in unrelated port causes cycle
                          to start over again.

This causes the bug below because the first active transition will
cause Nova to boot the VM. At this point tempest tests expect the
ports that belong to the VM to be in the ACTIVE state so it filters
Neutron port list calls with "status=ACTIVE". Therefore tempest would
not get any ports back and assume there was some kind of error with
the port and bail.

This patch just makes sure the admin state call is skipped if the port
doesn't exist and it includes a basic unit test to prevent a regression.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

Closes-Bug: #1523638
Change-Id: I5330c6111cbb20bf45aec9ade7e30d34e8dd16ca
(cherry picked from commit 96c67e22f9cba2ea0e7fb3ba2a63e4905e48c1a4)

===

Change-Id: I02971103407b4ec11a65218e9ef7e2708915d938

commit_message:
lb: avoid doing nova VIF work plumbing tap to qbr

neutron should rely on nova doing the job instead of trying to 'fix' it.
'Fixing' it introduces race conditions between lb agent and nova VIF
driver. Particularly, lb agent can scan for new tap devices in the
middle of nova plumbing qbr-tap setup, and attempt to do it on its own.
So if agent is more lucky to plug the tap device into the bridge, nova
may fail to do the same, getting the following error:

libvirtError: Unable to add bridge brqxxx-xx port tapxxx-xx: Device or
resource busy

This also requires a change in how the port admin_state_up is implemented
by setting the tap device's link state instead of moving it in or out
of the bridge.

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darragh O'Reilly <darragh.oreilly@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Scheuring <andreas.scheuring@de.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I02971103407b4ec11a65218e9ef7e2708915d938
Closes-Bug: #1312016

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: If90022aa967e9cd898b6ff97da9643102c2c8150

commit_message:
Make ceilometer sample interval configurable

This could already be configured via the ceilometer_pipeline_yaml_overrides
in theory, but in practice this is very unpractical as one would have to
override the whole sources configuration. Only overriding one key in a
list of dicts is not possible.

Change-Id: Ieb5569982f080446295cecc33fb70c6b5d1cb9d6
(cherry picked from commit 6ca135ebbce28562bddf4de35dee701c3334c0b6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer refs/changes/97/391797/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Sampling interval for ceilometer-polling services ceilometer_sample_interval: 600 ceilometer_meter_sample_interval: "{{ ceilometer_sample_interval }}" ceilometer_cpu_source_sample_interval: "{{ ceilometer_sample_interval }}" ceilometer_disk_source_sample_interval: "{{ ceilometer_sample_interval }}" ceilometer_network_source_sample_interval: "{{ ceilometer_sample_interval }}"

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ib906fa3a67a8d70174da10608921a1a213dfd739
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum refs/changes/13/386813/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: failed_when: false

subject: Use global openstack service protocols by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 17:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_barbican/commit/074400e893f96c0eaa166ba307bc55a24de4d15f', 'message': "Use global openstack service protocols by default

For consistency and smoother integration with other OSA roles,
make use of the global openstack_service_*_proto variables to build
service URLs. The barbican_service_*_protocol variables have also been
renamed with 'proto'.

Change-Id: Ice6a74887faded323d6ac02eba0e1a3a738ec903
"}]
commit_message:
Use global openstack service protocols by default

For consistency and smoother integration with other OSA roles,
make use of the global openstack_service_*_proto variables to build
service URLs. The barbican_service_*_protocol variables have also been
renamed with 'proto'.

Change-Id: Ice6a74887faded323d6ac02eba0e1a3a738ec903
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_barbican refs/changes/26/391926/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: barbican_service_proto: http barbican_service_publicuri_proto: "{{ openstack_service_publicuri_proto | default(barbican_service_proto) }}" barbican_service_adminuri_proto: "{{ openstack_service_adminuri_proto | default(barbican_service_proto) }}" barbican_service_internaluri_proto: "{{ openstack_service_internaluri_proto | default(barbican_service_proto) }}" barbican_service_publicurl: "{{ barbican_service_publicuri_proto }}://{{ external_lb_vip_address }}:{{ barbican_service_port }}" barbican_service_internalurl: "{{ barbican_service_internaluri_proto }}://{{ internal_lb_vip_address }}:{{ barbican_service_port }}" barbican_service_adminurl: "{{ barbican_service_adminuri_proto }}://{{ internal_lb_vip_address }}:{{ barbican_service_port }}"
deleted_lines: barbican_service_publicuri_protocol: http barbican_service_publicurl: "{{ barbican_service_publicuri_protocol }}://{{ external_lb_vip_address }}:{{ barbican_service_port }}" barbican_service_internaluri_protocol: http barbican_service_internalurl: "{{ barbican_service_internaluri_protocol }}://{{ internal_lb_vip_address }}:{{ barbican_service_port }}" barbican_service_adminuri_protocol: http barbican_service_adminurl: "{{ barbican_service_adminuri_protocol }}://{{ internal_lb_vip_address }}:{{ barbican_service_port }}"

commit_message:
Fixing 'join' task completion logic

* The entire workflow was failing if one of a join task's inbound
  tasks failed even if there was 'on-error' clause in task
  defaults.

Change-Id: Ie5864740ed6356d87bcedf9a6cfd0e733e8795a8
Closes-Bug: #1635841
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/10/390010/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_delete_join_completion_check_on_stop(self): def test_delete_join_completion_check_on_execution_delete(self): def test_no_workflow_error_after_inbound_error(self): wf_text = """--- version: "2.0" wf: output: continue_flag: <% $.get(continue_flag) %> task-defaults: on-error: - change_continue_flag tasks: task_a: action: std.fail on-success: - task_c: <% $.get(continue_flag) = null %> - task_a_process task_a_process: action: std.noop task_b: on-success: - task_c: <% $.get(continue_flag) = null %> task_c: join: all change_continue_flag: publish: continue_flag: false """ wf_service.create_workflows(wf_text) wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('wf', {}) self.await_workflow_success(wf_ex.id)

commit_message:
Add gnocchi-dbsync command

Additionally, add unified CLI commands services preparation
to be used by gnocchi-api and gnocchi-dbsync.

Change-Id: I534f6221a2e9c6810053be4872acad15cc69d551
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/26/96426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gnocchi-api = gnocchi.cli:api gnocchi-dbsync = gnocchi.cli:storage_dbsync

commit_message:
Update OpenStack documentation template

As we will upload documentation to developer.openstack.org, this
patch switch sphinx template from 'osloshpinx' to
'openstackdocstheme'

Change-Id: I8073e72c11117ec605dcc8441a0c091f030014f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/js-openstack-lib refs/changes/29/390629/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import openstackdocstheme 'sphinx.ext.autodoc'# A few variables have to be set for the log-a-bug feature. # giturl: The location of conf.py on Git. Must be set manually. # gitsha: The SHA checksum of the bug description. Extracted from git log. # bug_tag: Tag for categorizing the bug. Must be set manually. # bug_project: Launchpad project to file bugs against. # These variables are passed to the logabug code via html_context. giturl = u'http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/js-openstack-lib/tree/doc/source' git_cmd = "/usr/bin/git log | head -n1 | cut -f2 -d' '" gitsha = os.popen(git_cmd).read().strip('\n') bug_tag = "docs" # source tree pwd = os.getcwd() # html_context allows us to pass arbitrary values into the html template html_context = {"pwd": pwd, "gitsha": gitsha, "bug_tag": bug_tag, "giturl": giturl} # The theme to use for HTML and HTML Help pages. See the documentation for # a list of builtin themes. html_theme = 'openstackdocs' # Add any paths that contain custom themes here, relative to this directory. html_theme_path = [openstackdocstheme.get_html_theme_path()]
deleted_lines: 'sphinx.ext.autodoc', 'oslosphinx'# The theme to use for HTML and HTML Help pages. Major themes that come with # Sphinx are currently 'default' and 'sphinxdoc'. # html_theme_path = ["."] # html_theme = '_theme' # html_static_path = ['static']

commit_message:
Added support for multi-region catalog

OpenStack wrapper will read the 'region_name' from config, and use
the correct endpoint matching this region

Change-Id: I01049f3bed227eb1e11f9a1f7d338177e95aef34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/js-openstack-lib refs/changes/15/390515/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: const config = this.getConfig(); .then((entry) => entry.endpoints.find((endpoint) => { return endpoint.region === config.region_name && endpoint.interface === 'public'; }));

commit_message:
Remove old authtoken options

Since we are in ocata lets remove all
old parameters in api to configure
the keystone_authtoken section

Change-Id: I6d023c3092e735d5cc021169c43c847df446b2aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-aodh refs/changes/54/378154/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_default($password) { keystone::resource::authtoken { 'aodh_config': username => $username, password => $password, project_name => $project_name, auth_url => $auth_url, auth_uri => $auth_uri, auth_type => $auth_type, user_domain_name => $user_domain_name, project_domain_name => $project_domain_name, memcached_servers => $memcached_servers,
deleted_lines: if is_service_default($password) and ! $::aodh::api::keystone_password { $username_real = pick($::aodh::api::keystone_user, $username) $password_real = pick($::aodh::api::keystone_password, $password) $project_name_real = pick($::aodh::api::keystone_tenant, $project_name) $auth_uri_real = pick($::aodh::api::keystone_auth_uri, $auth_uri) $auth_url_real = pick($::aodh::api::keystone_identity_uri, $::aodh::api::keystone_auth_url, $auth_url) $memcached_servers_real = pick($::aodh::api::memcached_servers, $memcached_servers) $user_domain_name_real = pick($::aodh::api::keystone_user_domain_name, $user_domain_name) $project_domain_name_real = pick($::aodh::api::keystone_project_domain_name, $project_domain_name) $auth_type_real = pick($::aodh::api::keystone_auth_type, $auth_type) keystone::resource::authtoken { 'aodh_config': username => $username_real, password => $password_real, project_name => $project_name_real, auth_url => $auth_url_real, auth_uri => $auth_uri_real, auth_type => $auth_type_real, user_domain_name => $user_domain_name_real, project_domain_name => $project_domain_name_real, memcached_servers => $memcached_servers_real,

instance being evacuated. This patch fixes the external event
dispatching to check for migration when handling events. If an
instance is being migrated, the event is copied to the destination

fixes a bug where a VIF appearing as active would allow an evacuation
to complete because the libvirt driver thought there were no Neutron
external events to wait for before booting the instance. See

migration. If an instance is being migrated, the source and
