commit_message:
Send events to all relevant hosts if migrating

Previously, external events were sent to the instance object's host
field. This patch fixes the external event dispatching to check for
migration. If an instance is being migrated, the source and
destination compute are added to the set of hosts to which the event
is sent.

Change-Id: If00736ab36df4a5a3be4f02b0a550e4bcae77b1b
Closes-bug: 1535918
Closes-bug: 1624052

subject: Fix same-host offline install race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 11:42:18.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install_offline.yml', 'tasks/install_source.yml', 'handlers/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install/commit/67908a2338404ff8372df89ec9b1585552deeaf6', 'message': 'Fix same-host offline install race

When pip_offline_install is used on a deployment such as an AIO where
the host being installed to ie. "aio1" is also the deployment host,
a race condition existed where the pip wheels would be downloaded,
uploaded to the same path on the target host, and then cleaned up
from the deployment host before the installation was continued.

The result is a race condition where the wheels are removed from
the target prior to installation due to the target being local.

This changes the pip offline install cleanup to run as a handler
so the cleanup can take place after the role has completed its work
with the cached wheels.

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389269/

Change-Id: Ibf36118d42950f0f64f83b6ffc3601c9a241289d
(cherry picked from commit d3a2adc67cac9a48f0de96e2e14f7faf1d0cf5b4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix same-host offline install race

When pip_offline_install is used on a deployment such as an AIO where
the host being installed to ie. "aio1" is also the deployment host,
a race condition existed where the pip wheels would be downloaded,
uploaded to the same path on the target host, and then cleaned up
from the deployment host before the installation was continued.

The result is a race condition where the wheels are removed from
the target prior to installation due to the target being local.

This changes the pip offline install cleanup to run as a handler
so the cleanup can take place after the role has completed its work
with the cached wheels.

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389269/

Change-Id: Ibf36118d42950f0f64f83b6ffc3601c9a241289d
(cherry picked from commit d3a2adc67cac9a48f0de96e2e14f7faf1d0cf5b4)

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 07:17:44.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/mapr/domain/service.py', 'sahara/utils/resources.py', 'sahara/plugins/provisioning.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/61e873a994e0b2e4f65db3f0e89951b2432bd52f', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I026d479c7ced30c180842fbacfeb491eddc3f242
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I026d479c7ced30c180842fbacfeb491eddc3f242
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/29/387829/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

transport_url setting.

commit_message:
Fix docker daemon proxy support in vagrant

There was an unwanted line break in the systemd file preventing the proxy from
being configured correctly.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I3e6413d4f2d373951cb558e0af1b8bc92d4cbb91

self.eng.cluster_scale_in, self.ctx, 'CLUSTER', count='one') self.assertEqual(exc.InvalidParameter, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("Invalid value 'one' specified for 'count'", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_scale_in, self.ctx, 'CLUSTER', count=0) self.assertEqual(exc.InvalidParameter, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("Invalid value '0' specified for 'count'", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) @mock.patch.object(su, 'check_size_params') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') def test_cluster_scale_in_failed_size_check(self, mock_find, mock_check): x_cluster = mock.Mock(desired_capacity=4) mock_find.return_value = x_cluster mock_check.return_value = 'size limit' ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_scale_in, self.ctx, 'FAKE_CLUSTER', 2) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: size limit.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_CLUSTER') mock_check.assert_called_once_with(x_cluster, 2)

commit_message:
Connect to remote hosts as root

Since this is the user for which we setup the SSH key.

This commit allows to run kolla-ansible as vagrant user without using
sudo.

This only applies to multinode.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie5231085a66511a520d4dbe5e9f35414acf1900b
(cherry picked from commit aba8add54124ce831cc92edcf503892b2e3cb6e5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/77/383177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: remote_user = root

commit_message:
Only keep localhost for 127.0.0.1

The regex used previously would keep the short hostname (hostname -s)
on the 127.0.0.1 line.

Reset the 127.0.0.1 line to keep only localhost.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I90bdec6793ac5b2d304e178e5114369b7b3b9626
(cherry picked from commit 5f7973292767b40403b775627b7fe13b7ab1ae41)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/76/383176/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i -r "s,^127\.0\.0\.1\s+.*,127\.0\.0\.1 localhost localhost.localdomain localhost4 localhost4.localdomain4," /etc/hosts

commit_message:
Set internal vip to vagrant private network

In vagrant environments, the kolla_internal_vip_address didn't belong
to the private network provisioned on the machine and was failing the
prechecks.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0e7e4d134e350c49ef7510c7262677754a83bcbf
(cherry picked from commit 5718356eb23e614b27f0115e8e9ce4d96d4cb7ab)

added_lines: # Set VIP address to be on the vagrant private network sed -i -r "s,^[# ]*kolla_internal_vip_address:.+$,kolla_internal_vip_address: \"172.28.128.254\"," /etc/kolla/globals.yml

commit_message:
Refer to operator VM as primary VM

This allows us to execute vagrant commands by default on the 'operator'
VM and eliminate one of the difference between AIO and multinode.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ia14aa026d1146ec4b1e006c72a2460edfc0cf6eb
(cherry picked from commit acfe3b73aacafe4f118b62537b6acfc3b017def3)

added_lines: config.vm.define "operator", primary: true do |admin|

* sudo is not needed as script already runs as root, using sudo would

  require http_* env vars to be carried through.

* Add a systemd unit file to configure docker proxy support

commit_message:
Improve Vagrants bootstrap.sh proxy support

* sudo is not needed as script already runs as root, using sudo would
  require http_* env vars to be carried through.

* Add a systemd unit file to configure docker proxy support

* Update /etc/bashrc if available proxy

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If2571389ec3dc5bce9e819acf962d202b3166b97
(cherry picked from commit d2a62c96cdbb12b2811e5d04e70adaadbd0cd350)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/72/383172/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: REGISTRY_URL="operator.local" REGISTRY=${REGISTRY_URL}:${REGISTRY_PORT} apt-get install -y lsb-release yum -y install redhat-lsb-core if [[ "${http_proxy}" != "" ]]; then mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d cat >/etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/http-proxy.conf <<-EOF [Service] Environment="HTTP_PROXY=${http_proxy}" "HTTPS_PROXY=${https_proxy}" "NO_PROXY=localhost,127.0.0.1,${REGISTRY_URL}" EOF if [[ "$(grep http_ /etc/bashrc)" == "" ]]; then echo "export http_proxy=${http_proxy}" >> /etc/bashrc echo "export https_proxy=${https_proxy}" >> /etc/bashrc fi fi
deleted_lines: REGISTRY=operator.local:${REGISTRY_PORT} sudo apt-get install -y lsb-release sudo yum install -y redhat-lsb-core

Engine support for cluster scale in/out v2

This adds scaling support to clusters using versioned object.

Change-Id: I8b277b2b1814ad63a596e67881dcf6759bd6519f

commit_message:
Enable telemetry services by default on undercloud

Currently we have some users who are still using ceilometer on
undercloud. Turning this on by default keeps the behavior
consistent for upgrades. If not used, this can be turned off
easily in undercloud.conf.

Change-Id: Ie14f778f4e5a8d740d31cbddffc239fdb449f23d
(cherry picked from commit 1aae46b432280f2fb686ac6749fee76ac9337d68)

added_lines: class TestClusterScaleIn(test_base.SenlinTestCase): def test_init(self): sot = clusters.ClusterScaleInRequest(identity='foo', count=5) self.assertEqual('foo', sot.identity) self.assertEqual(5, sot.count) def test_init_failed(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterScaleInRequest, identity='foo', count=-1) self.assertEqual("Value must be >= 0 for field 'count'..", six.text_type(ex)) class TestClusterScaleOut(test_base.SenlinTestCase): def test_init(self): sot = clusters.ClusterScaleOutRequest(identity='foo', count=5) self.assertEqual('foo', sot.identity) self.assertEqual(5, sot.count) def test_init_failed(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterScaleOutRequest, identity='foo', count=-1) self.assertEqual("Value must be >= 0 for field 'count'..", six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory in app-catalog which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator, so don't use this directory any more.
We should drop it for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: If7207a2df3e257bded892ff556e045bb02a6d895

commit_message:
Switch security role checks to voting

This patch adjusts the security role checks for RHEL 7 STIG content
to a voting status, and adds the same verification to the gate as well.

Change-Id: I9b0d8b66731fc1f85132f14d99d3d14ead20def0

commit_message:
Added lxd password to the secrets file

In order to deplpoy LXD compute types the lxd password is required. This
change adds the `lxd_trust_password` variable to the default passwords
file so that a strong password is generated by default even if it's not
to be used intitally.

Change-Id: Ifb7ec681043b02bbbbcd53bcba01653097a55253
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
networking-bagpipe: add tempest, cover, python3 and periodic jobs

This change adds, for the networking-bagpipe:
- periodic test jobs
- a cover job, initially as experimental
- a python35 job, initially as experimental
- tempest full suite testing for bagpipe ML2 driver

Additionally, this change adds the networking-bgpvpn tempest job
as a test for the networking-bagpipe project, which is is motivated
by the facts that:
- networking-bagpipe has the foundation code for the reference driver
of the networking-bgpvpn project (it's currently the most important
use of networking-bagpipe)
- the networking-bgpvpn project has a tempest job to validate deployment
and use with bagpipe driver for bgpvpn

Change-Id: I4828ed362d6d388c757684df8d81771e7416a890

should be same.

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Karbor already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ia1e0f3411c8be2eead9e760bb839b7902eee43bd
Closes-Bug:#1608980
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/51/386351/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Transactions manager uses custom node serialization

In transaction manager we need some custom node
serializer, since there is different number of fields
and raw status of node instead of calculated status of node.
So the new NodeSerializerForDeployment was introduced.

Change-Id: Id78a8549a293c98acf0bcd0d4c174e551ecf666a
Related-Bug: 1630605
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/90/387090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def to_dict(cls, instance, fields=None, serializer=None): :param serializer: the custom serializer serializer = serializer or cls.serializer return serializer.serialize(instance, fields=fields) def to_json(cls, instance, fields=None, serializer=None): :param serializer: the custom serializer cls.to_dict(instance, fields=fields, serializer=serializer) def to_list(cls, iterable=None, fields=None, serializer=None): :param serializer: the custom serializer use_iterable = cls.all() if iterable is None else iterable return [ cls.single.to_dict(o, fields=fields, serializer=serializer) for o in use_iterable ]
deleted_lines: def to_dict(cls, instance, fields=None): return cls.serializer.serialize(instance, fields=fields) def to_json(cls, instance, fields=None): cls.to_dict(instance, fields=fields) def to_list(cls, iterable=None, fields=None): use_iterable = iterable or cls.all() return map( lambda o: cls.single.to_dict(o, fields=fields), use_iterable )

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Related-Bug: #1547712

Change-Id: I54b4ceb63087578917cba9c38710992b0a64e056
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/68/378168/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change admin panel's policy_rules

In mitaka, horizon support domain scoped token.
When we use this feature, if a user who is not an operator
(cloud admin)but has the admin role, this user can access to
Admin panel. So, the user can also see information including
other domains. In addition, many operations which are allowed
by 'admin'(actually in this case it intends 'cloud admin')
can be done by the user.
Originally, other components should be addressed about
keystone v3 model. But now it doesn't finish yet. so this
patch change the policy to access to Admin panel.

Change-Id: I4937e3929d1169a23990bb18f4637ff54e1a7d39
Closes-Bug: #1598047
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/31/336431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: policy_rules = (('identity', 'cloud_admin'),) ''' # TODO(kenji-i): The goal is not to depend on particular component # when we control dashboards and panels. # However almost components don't address the concept defined by # Keystone v3 yet. (admin has meanings not only 'cloud admin' but # also 'domain admin'.) # Therefore, here should be used the policy of 'cloud_admin' until # other components address it. '''

commit_message:
Use 'openstack security group rule list' to replace 'nova' command

The command 'nova secgroup-list-rules' is deprecated and will be
removed after Nova 15.0.0 is released, so this patch use
'openstack security group rule list' to replace it for cleanup.

Change-Id: I0d02f4bb1dde5cc369910bee3365b8696ca41c89
Implements: blueprint use-openstack-command
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/80/389980/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ openstack security group rule list SECURITY_GROUP_NAME

commit_message:
Minor revise clustering_client for tempest test

This patch minor revises clustering_client for tempest
test by renaming "_parsed_resp" function to "get_resp"
to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: If7fc60e57c721ad4124a0c6ecc4e827974141858
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/17/392017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def _parsed_resp(self, resp, body): return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body) return self._parsed_resp(resp, body)

commit_message:
Rename request object classes for cluster/node list

This patch renames request object classes of cluster/node list
from '**ListRequestBody' to '**ListRequest' for these two classes
actually define the list request rather than request body.

Change-Id: I15bf1207e41acaa53a6750f323417ae4c90a9bbb

commit_message:
batch policy support "cluster delete"

Add support for "cluster_delete" action of batch policy.

Basically, batch policy will divide the node list to two
batches, and return the size of batches to action handler
layer.

Change-Id: Ib9f02b45e9470ee3ea7097e94f031ec4db57e978
Implements: blueprint support-batching-policy

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Id11819a28bab957f2251051e5bbd4fca6c67ad08

commit_message:
redhat-common remove 15-grub-add --replacepkgs to rpm install

on some of the latest distro like fedora24 grub2 is already installed,
Also some elements install grub2. The following code was failing because
grub2 already installed and we want to replace it.

Change-Id: I733ab9792d7ce37b4497d00ed54b4f0a8dbdd00b

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 01:25:21.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/objects/datastore.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware/commit/436c03444a7238212cd05001072c8fb66ce214da', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I2d2277997177a378b8c0da2d7effe2d1580d8ac8
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I2d2277997177a378b8c0da2d7effe2d1580d8ac8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/11/387111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
Read all data while updating driver private data

While executing driver_private_data_update, it will try to read
all the existing data, including the deleted.

However, the argument read_deleted is set to None, which doesn't
actually mean reading all, cause it'll be covered by the read_deleted
parameter of admin context.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Ibe2b2dbc50ba125a1d58a5b2c1b85f6d4ace3872
Closes-Bug: #1617175
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/32/391032/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(u_glide): read_deleted='all' means here 'read all' session, context, entity_id, read_deleted='all').all()
deleted_lines: # NOTE(u_glide): read_deleted=None means here 'read all' session, context, entity_id, read_deleted=None).all()

commit_message:
Minor revise normalize_req

This patch minor revises normalize_req method to make 'key' an optional
parameter with default value of None. This is because in most cases,
key is None when normalize_req method is invoked.

Change-Id: I1fa316184548b646f0b5388c2cb6c2397a8ce12a

commit_message:
Fix status_reson when active nodes equal to desired

When active nodes equal to desired_capacity.
It shows "number of active nodes is above desired_capacity(3)."
This patch fix this issue.

Change-Id: I17b063829b4346db6fd8bc53685f761771dabbac

added_lines: elif ((max_size < 0 or active_count <= max_size) and (active_count == desired)): status = consts.CS_ACTIVE reason = _("%(o)s: number of active nodes is equal to " "desired_capacity " "(%(n)d).") % {'o': operation, 'n': desired}

commit_message:
Changed the home-page of Ironic-specs in setup.cfg

Instead of pointing to openstack.org, the homepage has been

commit_message:
Boot a server from a non-bootable volume

The purpose of the test is to validate that creating a server
from a non-bootable volume should fail.

Change-Id: I82449503fa44a5593c115e40dcd9be1555798a68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/41/355441/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.lib import exceptions @test.idempotent_id('74085be3-a370-4ca2-bc51-2d0e10e0f573') @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'image') def test_bootable_volume_flag(self): """This test case verifies boot parameter manipulation The following is the scenario outline: 1. Create a volume from image. 2. Update volume bootable status to false. 3. Try creating a server from non-bootable volume. 4. Update volume bootable status to true. 5. Create a server from bootable volume. """ # Create a volume from image volume = self._create_volume_from_image() # Update volume bootable status to false self.volumes_client.set_bootable_volume(volume['id'], bootable=False) # Verify bootable flag was updated nonbootable_vol = self.volumes_client.show_volume( volume['id'])['volume'] self.assertEqual('false', nonbootable_vol['bootable']) # Try creating a server from non-bootable volume self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self._boot_instance_from_volume, volume['id']) # Update volume bootable status to true self.volumes_client.set_bootable_volume(volume['id'], bootable=True) # Verify bootable flag was updated bootable_vol = self.volumes_client.show_volume( volume['id'])['volume'] self.assertEqual('true', bootable_vol['bootable']) # Create a server from bootable volume server = self._boot_instance_from_volume(volume['id']) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'in-use') # Verify server was booted from the bootable volume server_details = self.servers_client.show_server( server['id'])['server'] self.assertEqual( volume['id'], server_details['os-extended-volumes:volumes_attached'][0]['id'])

commit_message:
Simplify resources module in RPC callbacks

This just eliminates some repetition and intermediary
variables that weren't necessary in the RPC callbacks
resources file. This makes adding a new resources as simple
as adding one line to the _VALID_CLS tuple and a constant name
for external references.

Partially-Implements: push-notificaitons
Change-Id: Icb63cb8a1251e103ae4483c71c6ac6868917c4ec

commit_message:
Deprecate old auth parameters of ironic

The auth parameters `admin_username`, `admin_password`,
`admin_tenant_name` and `admin_url` of the [ironic] config
option group are now deprecated and will be removed in a
future release. Using these parameters will log a warning.
Please use `username`, `password`, `project_name `and
`auth_url` instead.

Change-Id: I931aff12a20b31308ee26534138c8e99db6eb0c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/06/361906/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - The auth parameters `admin_username`, `admin_password`, `admin_tenant_name` and `admin_url` of the [ironic] config option group are now deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Using these parameters will log a warning. Please use `username`, `password`, `project_name` and `auth_url` instead.

subject: Don't log datestamp by default in functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-24 00:22:51.000000000', 'files': ['tests/run_functests.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/6fb658a5f1bbc38baa07bb2f51acc6528b8c017a', 'message': 'Don't log datestamp by default in functional tests

We're getting double time-stamps in the console log of upstream jobs.
Move the logging of a prefix datestamp into a "-t" option to retain
the status quo prior to Id9ea5131f0026c292ca6453ba2c80fe12c47f808 (we
could, of course, do it the other way and turn if off in the jobs, but
since we didn't have it before...)

While poking, make the time-stamp consistent and always prefixed if -t
is turned on.

Also, it seems the parallel options got a bit of sync with what got
merged.  Add "-j" documentation and remove unused "p" option.

Change-Id: Ic7c2ebeca3f9d5784cac59505b6e6181151f5805
'}]
commit_message:
Don't log datestamp by default in functional tests

We're getting double time-stamps in the console log of upstream jobs.
Move the logging of a prefix datestamp into a "-t" option to retain
the status quo prior to Id9ea5131f0026c292ca6453ba2c80fe12c47f808 (we
could, of course, do it the other way and turn if off in the jobs, but
since we didn't have it before...)

While poking, make the time-stamp consistent and always prefixed if -t
is turned on.

Also, it seems the parallel options got a bit of sync with what got
merged.  Add "-j" documentation and remove unused "p" option.

Change-Id: Ic7c2ebeca3f9d5784cac59505b6e6181151f5805
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/26/390126/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local log log="[$pr] $a" if [[ ${LOG_DATESTAMP} -ne 0 ]]; then log="$(date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M%S.%N") ${log}" fi echo "${log}" local log="[JOB-CONTROL] ${msg}" if [[ ${LOG_DATESTAMP} -ne 0 ]]; then log="$(date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M%S.%N") ${log}" fi echo "${log}"# # Default values #LOG_DATESTAMP=0 # # Parse args # while getopts ":hlj:t" opt; do echo " -j : parallel job count (default to 1)" echo " -t : prefix log messages with timestamp" t) LOG_DATESTAMP=1 ;;
deleted_lines: echo $(date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M%S.%N") "[$pr] $a" printf "[JOB-CONTROL] %s %s\n" "$(date)" "${msg}" while getopts ":hlpj:" opt; do echo " -p : run all tests in parallel"

commit_message:
Revise cluster_policy_get_by_type

When filters include enabled and policy_type, exact_filter can not
be used on ClusterPolicies directly, because policy_type is not
the property of ClusterPolicies.

Change-Id: Ief7dd8f59dddc7f17c7be875d86b662411fb4398
Related-Bug: 1634407
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/26/391326/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: key_enabled = consts.CP_ENABLED if filters and key_enabled in filters: filter_enabled = {key_enabled: filters[key_enabled]} query = utils.exact_filter(query, models.ClusterPolicies, filter_enabled)
deleted_lines: if filters: query = utils.exact_filter(query, models.ClusterPolicies, filters)

Change "Openstack" to "OpenStack"

http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/word-choice.html
We should use OpenStack instead of Openstack.

subject: Show tracing around sourcing environment.d files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 02:39:02.000000000', 'files': ['bin/dib-run-parts'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dib-utils/commit/51661c33a5ea4cfa68d39450cc1b96c3db36b037', 'message': 'Show tracing around sourcing environment.d files

Sourcing of environment files is a bit different than running scripts,
because they are imported into the current environment.  That means
that if they are fiddling with "set -x" you can get odd things in the
output -- for example, if one environment file enables tracing then
all proceeding sourcing will have it on, but all the files sourced
before will not have output.  This is super confusing.

It's also very helpful to see how things are being expanded as they
set environment variables.

Thus I think the best idea is for environment files to leave tracing
alone and dib-run-parts can a) give a useful output about what file it
is sourcing and b) enable tracing around the import, then restore it
to the previous state afterwards.

Change-Id: I29f7df1514aeb988222d1094e8269eddb485c2a0
'}]
commit_message:
Show tracing around sourcing environment.d files

Sourcing of environment files is a bit different than running scripts,
because they are imported into the current environment.  That means
that if they are fiddling with "set -x" you can get odd things in the
output -- for example, if one environment file enables tracing then
all proceeding sourcing will have it on, but all the files sourced
before will not have output.  This is super confusing.

It's also very helpful to see how things are being expanded as they
set environment variables.

Thus I think the best idea is for environment files to leave tracing
alone and dib-run-parts can a) give a useful output about what file it
is sourcing and b) enable tracing around the import, then restore it
to the previous state afterwards.

Change-Id: I29f7df1514aeb988222d1094e8269eddb485c2a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dib-utils refs/changes/68/388968/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local xtrace output "Sourcing environment file ${env_file}" # Set tracing as we import these environment files; it's # nice to see the definitions in the logs xtrace=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set -o xtrace $xtrace

subject: Don't set tracing in environment files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 03:00:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer/developing_elements.rst', 'bin/dib-lint', 'elements/centos/environment.d/00-bootloader.bash', 'elements/manifests/environment.d/14-manifests'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/9e392f56b0b78f60bc2598c3cd99f8d7061cc550', 'message': "Don't set tracing in environment files

Because environment files are sourced into the current environment,
they shouldn't be setting global settings like tracing else they
affect every preceeding import.  This is quite confusing when only
half your imports are traced in the logs, because it was either turned
on, or off, by a preceeding environment import.

There is a corresponding dib-run-parts change in
I29f7df1514aeb988222d1094e8269eddb485c2a0 that will greatly increase
debugability for environment files by deliberately logging what files
are sourced and consistently turning on tracing around their import.

This isn't strictly necessary (since dib-run-parts with the prior
change will just turn tracing off after import anyway) but it's a
decent cleanup for consistency.  A bare-minimum dib-lint check is
added.  Documentation is updated.

Change-Id: I10f68be0642835a04af7e5a2bc101502f61e5357
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set tracing in environment files

Because environment files are sourced into the current environment,
they shouldn't be setting global settings like tracing else they
affect every preceeding import.  This is quite confusing when only
half your imports are traced in the logs, because it was either turned
on, or off, by a preceeding environment import.

There is a corresponding dib-run-parts change in
I29f7df1514aeb988222d1094e8269eddb485c2a0 that will greatly increase
debugability for environment files by deliberately logging what files
are sourced and consistently turning on tracing around their import.

This isn't strictly necessary (since dib-run-parts with the prior
change will just turn tracing off after import anyway) but it's a
decent cleanup for consistency.  A bare-minimum dib-lint check is
added.  Documentation is updated.

Change-Id: I10f68be0642835a04af7e5a2bc101502f61e5357

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 10:27:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/93828c7e33ba46628f47cabb22610fc3f2db8096', 'message': "Fix IPv6 PD with pluggable IPAM

A PD-sepcific check that was present in the non-pluggable IPAM

Change-Id: I6a2e7cd60dd42d92b900a57bd8f3ffbc5909908e

commit_message:
Fix IPv6 PD with pluggable IPAM

A PD-sepcific check that was present in the non-pluggable IPAM
backend was missing from the pluggable version, causing router
interfaces to be created with a '::1' IP (equal to the gateway on
PD subnets). The resulting command:

ip netns exec <router_namespace> ip -6 addr add ::1/64

would then fail. This patch restores the check to ensure that
'::1' is not used for router interface ports, and introduces a
test to protect against future regressions.

Change-Id: I6a2e7cd60dd42d92b900a57bd8f3ffbc5909908e
Closes-Bug: 1631693
(cherry picked from commit 14ffea4444985eb041181d1bdef9af53ccb4d9f9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/00/388600/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_test_fixed_ips_for_port_pd_gateway(self): context = mock.Mock() pluggable_backend = ipam_pluggable_backend.IpamPluggableBackend() with self.subnet(cidr=n_const.PROVISIONAL_IPV6_PD_PREFIX, ip_version=6) as subnet: subnet = subnet['subnet'] fixed_ips = [{'subnet_id': subnet['id'], 'ip_address': '::1'}] filtered_ips = (pluggable_backend. _test_fixed_ips_for_port(context, subnet['network_id'], fixed_ips, constants.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF, [subnet])) # Assert that ports created on prefix delegation subnets # will be returned without an ip address. This prevents router # interfaces being given the ::1 gateway address. self.assertEqual(1, len(filtered_ips)) self.assertEqual(subnet['id'], filtered_ips[0]['subnet_id']) self.assertNotIn('ip_address', filtered_ips[0])

commit_message:
Pecan: Don't prefetch resource fields on DELETE

The legacy wsgi does not prefetch resources and specify fields on
DELETE.  It does do this on PUTs though.  However, the pecan wsgi policy
hook was doing it for both PUT and DELETE.  This also fixes a failure
with the auto-allocated-topology tests.

Change-Id: I9933c141f7d0481caade5a9484022fe090cf47f0
Closes-Bug: #1633664

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I598eba9f7ca4ffef4ebf4354394e33af5a4b6dbd

commit_message:
Doctor check for LDAP domain specific configs

Added multiple checks for domain specific LDAP configurations
using file-based configurations:

- Set enabled & valid directory
- Filenames are in the correct format
- Parse values in each file

Change-Id: I47375088635d7b6634e2c8683772dc4f2ad11a93
Closes-Bug: #1604971

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver enhanced support logging

The NetApp cDOT driver logs some info about OpenStack deployments
already, and more info is needed about the specific storage
resources managed by Manila.

Implements: blueprint netapp-cdot-enhanced-support-logging
Change-Id: I8e4f81b3f1291e3c88fc88ab71ac93a415990ee3

subject: Faster id mapping lookup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 01:03:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/cab12d6e77d8dd22a6c5cb4029bc480652c1df10', 'message': 'Faster id mapping lookup

id_mapping_api was designed to make a query per entity to fetch
public ids. This lead to a very poor performance when there were many
entries in LDAP. For example, for 15k entries 15k MySQL queries were
required. For the first run 15k INSERTs were required, which makes
things even worse.

Change this behavior to fetch related mappings from MySQL as a list and
perform the necessary join in-memory. Add new users in bulk.

Closes-Bug: 1582585
Change-Id: I2c266e91f2f05be760f8a3eea3738868243cc9c6

commit_message:
Faster id mapping lookup

id_mapping_api was designed to make a query per entity to fetch
public ids. This lead to a very poor performance when there were many
entries in LDAP. For example, for 15k entries 15k MySQL queries were
required. For the first run 15k INSERTs were required, which makes
things even worse.

Change this behavior to fetch related mappings from MySQL as a list and
perform the necessary join in-memory.

bp ldap-preprocessing
Partial-Bug: 1582585
Change-Id: I2c266e91f2f05be760f8a3eea3738868243cc9c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/94/339294/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_domain_mapping_list(self, domain_id): with sql.session_for_read() as session: return session.query(IDMapping).filter_by(domain_id=domain_id) def bulk_create_id_mappings(self, local_entities): mapping_refs = [] public_ids = [] for entity in local_entities: if 'public_id' not in entity: public_id = self.id_generator_api.generate_public_ID(entity) entity['public_id'] = public_id public_ids.append(entity['public_id']) mapping_refs.append(IDMapping.from_dict(entity)) with sql.session_for_write() as session: session.bulk_save_objects(mapping_refs) return public_ids

subject: Suppress unexpected file warnings for rsync temp files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-30 13:07:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/ff921f1733403394b0163a0c993048544549b5a8', 'message': 'no unexpected file warnings for rsync temp files

    Log no unexpected file warning for rsync temp files if the parsing of the t
    The file will be checked with a pre compiled regular expression which is a
    get_ondisk_files will return the file as unexpected but no warning will occ

    Closes-Bug: 1616504

Change-Id: I5a5d6e24710e4880776b32edcbc07021acf77676
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-30 17:09:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/51079485858754729d95fceb36cebe4022883a90', 'message': 'no unexpected file warnings for rsync temp files

Log no unexpected file warning for rsync temp files
if the parsing of the timespamp fails.
The file will be checked with a pre compiled regular expression
which is a class member.
get_ondisk_files will return it as an unexpected file
but no warning will occur.

    Closes-Bug: 1616504

Change-Id: I5a5d6e24710e4880776b32edcbc07021acf77676
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-31 19:43:19.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/2bd8d050fb5dec140ad23d5db1d281049954255b', 'message': 'Suppress unexpected file warnings for rsync temp files

Do not log unexpected file warning for rsync temp files when the parsing
of the timespamp fails.  If the file passes a regex test suppress the
logger waring, but still return it as an unexpected file from
get_ondisk_files.

Closes-Bug: 1616504

commit_message:
Suppress unexpected file warnings for rsync temp files

Do not log unexpected file warning for rsync temp files when the parsing
of the timespamp fails.  If the file passes a regex test suppress the
logger waring, but still return it as an unexpected file from
get_ondisk_files.

Closes-Bug: 1616504

Change-Id: I5a5d6e24710e4880776b32edcbc07021acf77676
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/58/391658/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re # regex for rsync temp files e.g. '.1472017820.44503.data.QBYCYU' self.rsync_temp_file_exp = re.compile('^\..*\.[0-9a-zA-Z]{6}$') # log warnings if it's not a rsync temp file if self.rsync_temp_file_exp.match(afile) is None: self.logger.warning('Unexpected file %s: %s', file_path, e)

commit_message:
Really whitelist the Murano tempest tests

In Iedad1e0871388965acefb806369dc32b6c85cbd9 we merged the Murano
implementation but did not properly whitelist the application_catalog
regex for running tempest tests.

It doesn't look like the Murano plugin cares, though, since it ran
anyway but let's clean this up.

Change-Id: I4dd4abc7265ef295a8e6a2ae911dd5ec08006523
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/50/391950/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "application_catalog" >> /tmp/openstack/tempest/test-whitelist.txt

commit_message:
Add replacepkgs to the manual ovs upgrade workaround and fix a typo

rpm command will return an exit 1 if ovs package is already
there and will exit the step_1.sh script. To get around this
force the update with --replacepkgs

Also remove the \ just before the $ which cause a syntax
error for the ceph storage

Change-Id: I11fcf688982ceda5eef7afc8904afae44300c2d9
Closes-bug: 1636748
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/92/390792/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: yum localinstall -y ./*.rpm

commit_message:
Add mpl-check to help with validating packages

Note:
- I haven't done anything special for different versions
- only really supporting mpl at this point (not hot or tosca etc)
- will need to dig a bit more to implement the remaining class checks

implements blueprint user-validation-tool

Change-Id: I624836ec821f631f09e1ec967de2ff6666e4138b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/70/306270/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mpl-check = murano.cmd.check:mainmpl_check.package = license = murano.checks.package:check_license manifest = murano.checks.package:check_manifest resources = murano.checks.package:check_resources classes = murano.checks.package:check_classes mpl_check.manifest = structure = murano.checks.manifest:structure classes = murano.checks.manifest:check_classes mpl_check.class = yaml-ok = murano.checks.class:yaml_ok manifest-consistent = murano.checks.class:manifest_consistent yaql-ok = murano.checks.class:yaql_ok mpl-structure = murano.checks.class:mpl_ok mpl-expressions = murano.checks.class:mpl_expressions

commit_message:
Provide the app developer with a tool to validate their app

As an Application Developer I want to be able to validate my workflows for
common syntax errors and typos (invalid yaml file, invalid muranopl
statements, etc.) I also want to be able to validate my whole application
package structure for common packaging errors (zipped with no -r, classes
mentioned in manifest, but not provided, etc.) in order to develop
applications faster, resolve issues with my application efficiently and
provide better support for my applications.

defines blueprint user-validation-tool

Change-Id: I7feba68924d38cdadbf45d89fdd9ec3fc44c781b

commit_message:
update required packages for opstools support

the packages required for opstools support (fluentd, sensu, and
related) were duplicated across all the overcloud elements.

this consolidates the opstools packages into a single
overcloud-opstools element and makes it a dependency of the
overcloud-* elements.  It also adds the missing fluentd secure-forward
plugin package.

Change-Id: I4df1bb0c4fdc3211ef32aaa112d1c46063c85309
(cherry picked from commit 82ccb486c19022eefc26a65647977345ce0f274f)

Add api-ref /auth/tokens/OS-PKI/revoked (v3)

in /api-ref.  This patch set adds the documentation for v3.
A separate patch set will be submitted for v2.

commit_message:
Remove PythonMySQL packages

PyMySQL is prefered to PythonMySQL for Sqlalchemy, as it provides
python3 support and is actively maintained, and is therefore the
currently recommended lib for db connections.
 * http://docs.openstack.org/newton/install-guide-rdo/environment-sql-database.html
 * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation

Kolla currently uses PyMySQL for all connections bar Barbican (which works fine
with PyMySQL), so this commit should have minimal impact outside of removing some
unrequired deps.

Change-Id: Ibb7661bf98ff0f66e3c9e65f0746db56eb4e7f14

fix missed kolla-toolbox dockerfile

Change-Id: If32ae93c945091d1228b16529c2ba06431789ab5

subject: Straighten driver.cleanup & destroy interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 14:11:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d2fbe9dd6e1efaeb884bc955997fa65abd88925c', 'message': "Straighten driver.cleanup & destroy interfaces

Currently cleanup interface has implicit flags destroy_disks and
destroy_vifs, and explicit flag 'delete instance service files', which
is calculated inside cleanup method using passed migrate_data parameter.

It does not look consistency and does not allow us to handle the files
deletion outside of migration flow, where migrate_data is not accesible.

This patch introduces straightforward delete_files flag into both
cleanup and destroy interfaces instead of migrate_data parameter.

Related-Bug: 1631481
Change-Id: I6a4b953d0cf652fd5926da47e71dae7688a9b8eb

commit_message:
Straighten driver.cleanup & destroy interfaces

Currently cleanup interface has implicit flags destroy_disks and
destroy_vifs, and explicit flag 'delete instance service files', which
is calculated inside cleanup method using passed migrate_data parameter.

It does not look consistency and does not allow us to handle the files
deletion outside of migration flow, where migrate_data is not accesible.

This patch introduces straightforward delete_files flag into both
cleanup and destroy interfaces instead of migrate_data parameter.

Related-Bug: 1631481
Change-Id: I6a4b953d0cf652fd5926da47e71dae7688a9b8eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/385492/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cleanup instance directory on revert resize

Currently revert resize operation does not delete instance directory on
target host in case of shared block storage usage. The reason is that
the code does not distinguish between shared block storage and shared
instance path, asking to leave instance disks and directory in both
cases. As the result the second attempt to resize the instance to the
same host fails.

With this patch the code figures out both flags separately and uses them
to correct destroy the instance on the host.

The same change is added to _destroy_evacuated_instances method since it
potentially has the same problem.

Closes-Bug: 1631481
Change-Id: Icc995f3a7eda386a0a7d0a96b6662a1ab52d5d0e

commit_message:
Don't deprecate the LDAP property which is still needed

`user_attribute_ignore` or `group_attribute_ignore` are both needed
by identity ldap backend to judge whether a specific attribute could
be returned for read user or group operations.

Closes-Bug: #1637135
Change-Id: If623e1e4d3c827d00f17203652f33b74ac138d62

commit_message:
Correct the example keystone session code imports

This is a follow up to patch Ia3fd947ff619c11ff0ce474897533dcf7b49d9b3.
One of the imports for the keystone session example was wrong. It was
trying to import v3 like:

  from keystoneauth1 import v3

Whereas in my testing v3 actually exists deeper under identity:

  from keystoneauth1.identity import v3

This patch fixes this import in the example documentation.

Change-Id: Ie31144fe65116d20a36b83a96079a3804bf55f29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/91/391591/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneauth1.identity import v3

commit_message:
Remove self.instance from ConfigDrivePowerVM log

Commit
https://review.openstack.org/#q,I08962ce2757984e709cf51a4ae9ef654b7667d1a,n,z
added self.instance to a log message in ConfigDrivePowerVM, but that
class has no self.instance.  This results in an exception in the normal
code path.

In fixing the above, another anomalous exception/log was found and fixed
in the vif driver.

Change-Id: I12d99f6dcbfb2a283f282c9dff1d4addf4b51254
Closes-Bug: #1637656

commit_message:
Clarifying on the remove of `build_auth_context` middleware

Keystone just remove the check of admin token from
`build_auth_context` middleware, not the middleware itself.

bp removed-as-of-ocata
Change-Id: I9aa7a4dafb7f9a3333832d81923e4f11390dad14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/69/391069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The check for admin token from ``build_auth_context`` middleware has been removed. If your deployment requires the use of `admin token`, update ``keystone-paste.ini`` so that ``admin_token_auth`` is before ``build_auth_context`` in the paste pipelines, otherwise remove the ``admin_token_auth`` middleware from ``keystone-paste.ini`` entirely.
deleted_lines: The ``build_auth_context`` middleware has been removed. If your deployment requires use of the `admin token`, update ``keystone-paste.ini`` so that ``admin_token_auth`` is before ``build_auth_context`` in the paste pipelines, otherwise remove the ``admin_token_auth`` middleware entirely.

token_endpoint to admin_token for them. This has shown up a few times in

Change-Id: Ie083381e7fda19e016b6425939bd3c2dc260fa9b

commit_message:
Support token_endpoint as an auth_type

For backwards compat with what operators have been trained to do, map
token_endpoint to admin_token for them. This has shown up a few times in
the wild. Most recently:

https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5250

Change-Id: Ie083381e7fda19e016b6425939bd3c2dc260fa9b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/48/390148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif config['auth_type'] == 'token_endpoint': # Humans have been trained to use a thing called token_endpoint # That it does not exist in keystoneauth is irrelvant- it not # doing what they want causes them sorrow. config['auth_type'] = 'admin_token'

commit_message:
Fix AFS lang publishing

Liberty uses a specific openstack-doc-tools version that does not tag
the translated documents for the new AFS based docs publishing.

Add custom script to add the root-marker file to each guide.

Change-Id: I0a9ef8ed2476d05b70f2cc8c05e28aea7a00705a

commit_message:
Add purge_config option

Add the option in order to facilitate management.
User can ensure that only the options they hoped
are configured.

commit_message:
ceilometer-agent-central has been replaced by ceilometer-polling

The ceilometer-agent-central and ceilometer-agent-compute
services are now completely removed from the liberty release
of ceilometer. The new implementation is to use
ceilometer-polling and call the respective pollsters by
namespace.

Change-Id: I3af6fe9cc9c5b0fcf0406f89f402cbd1a31f66c4
Closes-Bug: 1606787
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceilometer refs/changes/38/351038/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OCF_RESKEY_binary_default="ceilometer-polling" OCF_RESKEY_additional_parameters=" --polling-namespaces central"

subject: Doc: qos-specs is always and only "Administrators only"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 03:58:13.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v2/qos-specs-v2-qos-specs.inc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/cff6c08c2ccf50d20c28efda805ae7797293b0bd', 'message': 'Doc: qos-specs is always and only "Administrators only"

Because of the underlying SQLAlchemy qos-specs functionality, which is
the only in-tree DB implementation, requiring context.is_admin to be
True, it's not technically correct to say "Administrators only,
depending on policy settings."  Even if the associated
volume_extension:qos_specs_manage policy doesn't require an
"administrator", the @requires_admin_context decorator on the
underlying functionality definitely will.

    ERROR: User does not have admin privileges (HTTP 403)

Change-Id: I0bc6a59c612b6c4ff7dcaff36dad712d8e3e03c2
Partial-Bug: #1621715
'}]
commit_message:
Doc: qos-specs is always and only "Administrators only"

Because of the underlying SQLAlchemy qos-specs functionality, which is
the only in-tree DB implementation, requiring context.is_admin to be
True, it's not technically correct to say "Administrators only,
depending on policy settings."  Even if the associated
volume_extension:qos_specs_manage policy doesn't require an
"administrator", the @requires_admin_context decorator on the
underlying functionality definitely will.

    ERROR: User does not have admin privileges (HTTP 403)

Change-Id: I0bc6a59c612b6c4ff7dcaff36dad712d8e3e03c2
Partial-Bug: #1621715
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/39/367739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Administrators only.
deleted_lines: Administrators only, depending on policy settings.

commit_message:
Deprecate MapR 5.1.0.mvr2

Since MapR 5.2 is released, 5.1 should be deprecated as 
current MapR plugin strategy is supporting a single version

Change-Id: I62050781f42ec12cc27d6dcc769b383ed623a782
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/24/366124/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - MapR 5.1.0.mrv2 is now deprecated and will be removed in Otaca release. It is recommended to use MapR 5.2.0.mrv2 instead.

subject: Disable SUBNETPOOLS for Ironic ramdisk source jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 17:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/a044716224a00e174bf7f4faede7d6e57011f68a', 'message': 'Disable SUBNETPOOLS for Ironic ramdisk source jobs

The default subnetpool CIDR seems to continue to cause issues with
external network routing in the Ironic Python Agent source jobs, this
patch disables subnetpools for these jobs until the issue is resolved in
devstack.

Change-Id: Ic29d2dcb06f55cea491f9e797405441860aa83f9
'}]
commit_message:
Disable SUBNETPOOLS for Ironic ramdisk source jobs

The default subnetpool CIDR seems to continue to cause issues with
external network routing in the Ironic Python Agent source jobs, this
patch disables subnetpools for these jobs until the issue is resolved in
devstack.

Change-Id: Ic29d2dcb06f55cea491f9e797405441860aa83f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/25/391925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"USE_SUBNETPOOL=False"

commit_message:
Support backup import on another Storage database

Currently a volume backup can only be restored on the same Block
Storage service. This is because restoring a volume from a backup
requires metadata available on the remote database.

This proposal is to store backup metadata together
with the data, so a user will be able to restore a volume backup
on another Block Storage.

Change-Id: I63075f38e551af943a671664a8951614d1b3849f
Implements: blueprint support-backup-import-on-another-storage-database

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 IBM Corp # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Implementation of a backup service that uses ProtecTIER as the backend. **Related Flags** :backup_object_size: The size in bytes of the objects used for volume backups (default: 52428800). :backup_pt_path: The path of PT backups. (default: /openstack_volumes_backup/) A prerequisite for using the IBM ProtecTIER backup service is configuring the host for using ProtecTIER. """ import hashlib import json import os import six import shutil import eventlet from oslo.config import cfg from cinder.backup.driver import BackupDriver from cinder import exception from oslo.utils import excutils from cinder.openstack.common import log as logging from oslo.utils import timeutils from oslo.utils import units LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) ProtecTIER_backup_service_opts = [ cfg.IntOpt('backup_object_size', default=52428800, help='The size in bytes of backup objects'), cfg.StrOpt('backup_pt_path', default='/openstack_volumes_backup/', help='The path of PT backups'), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(ProtecTIER_backup_service_opts) class ProtecTIERBackupDriver(BackupDriver): """Provides backup, restore and delete of backup Volumes using ProtecTIER.""" DRIVER_VERSION = '1.0.0' DRIVER_VERSION_MAPPING = {'1.0.0': '_protectier_restore_v1'} def __init__(self, context, db_driver=None): """Constructor""" super(ProtecTIERBackupDriver, self).__init__(context, db_driver) self.new_dir_for_volume_backup = CONF.backup_pt_path self.az = CONF.storage_availability_zone self.data_block_size_bytes = CONF.backup_object_size def _write_chunk_to_file(self, input_chunk, output_file): """write data chunk to file""" with open(output_file, 'w') as output_file_obj: output_file_obj.write(input_chunk) output_file_obj.close() LOG.debug('_write_chunk_to_file: %s' % output_file) def _generate_protectier_object_name_prefix(self, backup): """create name prefix for protectier objects""" az = 'az_%s' % self.az backup_name = '%s_backup_%s' % (az, backup['id']) volume = 'volume_%s' % (backup['volume_id']) timestamp = timeutils.strtime(fmt="%Y%m%d%H%M%S") prefix = volume + '/' + timestamp + '/' + backup_name LOG.debug('_generate_protectier_object_name_prefix: %s' % prefix) return prefix def _create_pt_object_name_dir(self, protectier_object_name_prefix): """create directory name from prefix""" temp_split = protectier_object_name_prefix.split("/") prefix = temp_split[0] + "/" + temp_split[1] + "/" LOG.debug('_create_pt_object_name_dir: %s' % prefix) return prefix def _write_metadata(self, backup, volume_id, object_list, volume_meta): """save metadata of a backup""" filename = 'metadata' LOG.debug('_write_metadata started' ' metadata filename: %(filename)s' % {'filename': filename}) metadata = {} metadata['version'] = self.DRIVER_VERSION metadata['backup_id'] = backup['id'] metadata['volume_id'] = volume_id metadata['backup_name'] = backup['display_name'] metadata['backup_description'] = backup['display_description'] metadata['created_at'] = str(backup['created_at']) metadata['objects'] = object_list metadata['volume_meta'] = volume_meta metadata_json = json.dumps(metadata, sort_keys=True, indent=2) self._write_chunk_to_file(metadata_json, self.pt_object_dir + filename) LOG.debug('_write_metadata finished') def _read_metadata(self, backup): """read metadata of a backup""" filename = 'metadata' LOG.debug('_read_metadata started' 'metadata filename: %(filename)s' % {'filename': filename}) with open(self.pt_object_dir + filename, 'r') \ as src_output_file_obj: metadata = json.loads(src_output_file_obj.read()) LOG.debug('_read_metadata finished (%s)' % metadata) return metadata def _prepare_backup(self, backup): """prepare a backup""" backup_id = backup['id'] volume_id = backup['volume_id'] volume = self.db.volume_get(self.context, volume_id) if volume['size'] <= 0: err = _('volume size %d is invalid.') % volume['size'] raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=err) object_prefix = self._generate_protectier_object_name_prefix(backup) self.pt_object_dir = self.new_dir_for_volume_backup + \ self._create_pt_object_name_dir(object_prefix) os.makedirs(self.pt_object_dir) backup['service_metadata'] = object_prefix self.db.backup_update(self.context, backup_id, {'service_metadata': object_prefix}) volume_size_bytes = volume['size'] * units.Gi availability_zone = self.az LOG.debug( 'starting backup of volume: %(volume_id)s to protectier,' ' volume size: %(volume_size_bytes)d, protectier object names' ' prefix %(object_prefix)s, availability zone:' ' %(availability_zone)s' % { 'volume_id': volume_id, 'volume_size_bytes': volume_size_bytes, 'object_prefix': object_prefix, 'availability_zone': availability_zone, }) object_meta = {'id': 1, 'list': [], 'prefix': object_prefix, 'volume_meta': None} return object_meta def _backup_chunk(self, backup, data, data_offset, object_meta): """Backup data chunk based on the object metadata and offset.""" object_prefix = object_meta['prefix'] object_list = object_meta['list'] object_id = object_meta['id'] object_name = '%s-%05d' % (object_prefix, object_id) obj = {} obj[object_name] = {} obj[object_name]['offset'] = data_offset obj[object_name]['length'] = len(data) LOG.debug('reading chunk of data from volume') LOG.debug('not compressing data') obj[object_name]['compression'] = 'none' az = 'az_%s' % self.az backup_name = '%s_backup_%s' % (az, backup['id']) output_file_name = '%s-%05d' % (backup_name, object_id) LOG.debug('About to write_chunk_to_file') try: self._write_chunk_to_file( data, self.pt_object_dir + output_file_name) except Exception as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception( _("Backup data chunk failed: %s") % six.text_type(err)) md5 = hashlib.md5(data).hexdigest() obj[object_name]['md5'] = md5 object_list.append(obj) object_id += 1 object_meta['list'] = object_list object_meta['id'] = object_id LOG.debug('Calling eventlet.sleep(0)') eventlet.sleep(0) def _finalize_backup(self, backup, object_meta): """Finalize the backup by updating its metadata on protectier.""" object_list = object_meta['list'] object_id = object_meta['id'] volume_meta = object_meta['volume_meta'] try: self._write_metadata(backup, backup['volume_id'], object_list, volume_meta) except Exception as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception( _("Finalize the backup failed: %s") % six.text_type(err)) self.db.backup_update(self.context, backup['id'], {'object_count': object_id}) LOG.debug('backup %s finished.' % backup['id']) def _backup_metadata(self, backup, object_meta): """Backup volume metadata.""" json_meta = self.get_metadata(backup['volume_id']) if not json_meta: LOG.debug("No volume metadata to backup") return object_meta["volume_meta"] = json_meta def backup(self, backup, volume_file, backup_metadata=True): """Backup the given volume to protectier.""" object_meta = self._prepare_backup(backup) while True: data = volume_file.read(self.data_block_size_bytes) data_offset = volume_file.tell() if data == '': break self._backup_chunk(backup, data, data_offset, object_meta) if backup_metadata: try: self._backup_metadata(backup, object_meta) except Exception as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception( _("Backup volume metadata to protectier failed: %s") % six.text_type(err)) self.delete(backup) self._finalize_backup(backup, object_meta) def _protectier_restore_v1(self, backup, volume_id, metadata, volume_file): """Restore a v1 volume backup from protectier.""" backup_id = backup['id'] LOG.debug('v1 volume backup restore of %s started', backup_id) metadata_objects = metadata['objects'] for metadata_object in metadata_objects: object_name = metadata_object.keys()[0] try: with open(self.new_dir_for_volume_backup + object_name, 'r') \ as src_output_file_obj: volume_file.write(src_output_file_obj.read()) LOG.debug('restoring object from protectier. backup: ' '%(backup_id)s, ' 'protectier object name: ' '%(object_name)s, volume: %(volume_id)s' % { 'backup_id': backup_id, 'object_name': object_name, 'volume_id': volume_id, }) except Exception as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception( _("Restore volume failed: %s") % six.text_type(err)) volume_file.flush() try: fileno = volume_file.fileno() except IOError: LOG.info("volume_file does not support fileno() so skipping " "fsync()") else: os.fsync(fileno) eventlet.sleep(0) LOG.debug('v1 volume backup restore of %s finished', backup_id) def restore(self, backup, volume_id, volume_file): """Restore the given volume backup from protectier.""" backup_id = backup['id'] object_prefix = backup['service_metadata'] LOG.debug( 'starting restore of backup %(object_prefix)s from protectier' 'to volume %(volume_id)s, ' 'backup: %(backup_id)s' % { 'object_prefix': object_prefix, 'volume_id': volume_id, 'backup_id': backup_id, }) self.pt_object_dir = self.new_dir_for_volume_backup + \ self._create_pt_object_name_dir(object_prefix) try: metadata = self._read_metadata(backup) except Exception as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception( _("Can not read metadata: %s") % six.text_type(err)) metadata_version = metadata['version'] LOG.debug('Restoring protectier backup version %s', metadata_version) try: restore_func = getattr(self, self.DRIVER_VERSION_MAPPING.get( metadata_version)) except TypeError: err = (_('No support to restore protectier backup version %s') % metadata_version) raise exception.InvalidBackup(reason=err) restore_func(backup, volume_id, metadata, volume_file) volume_meta = metadata.get('volume_meta', None) try: if volume_meta: self.put_metadata(volume_id, volume_meta) else: LOG.debug("No volume metadata in this backup") except exception.BackupMetadataUnsupportedVersion: msg = _("Metadata restore failed due to incompatible version") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BackupOperationError(msg) LOG.debug('restore %(backup_id)s to %(volume_id)s finished.' % {'backup_id': backup_id, 'volume_id': volume_id}) def delete(self, backup): """Delete the given backup from protectier.""" LOG.debug('delete started, backup: %s, prefix: %s', backup['id'], backup['service_metadata']) try: shutil.rmtree(self.new_dir_for_volume_backup + self._create_pt_object_name_dir( backup['service_metadata'])) except Exception as err: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception( _("Delete of a backup failed: %s") % six.text_type(err)) LOG.debug('delete %s finished' % backup['id']) def get_backup_driver(context): return ProtecTIERBackupDriver(context)

commit_message:
Add Boartty project

It's like Gertty, but for Storyboard.

Upstream is a copy of the current Gertty master, but with tags
removed.

commit_message:
Update db operation of cinder in "extra_specs"

When we config cinder with a few of types, and the non-admin user
may not have the "extra_specs" in the context or db may not retrun
the field. Now, if we want to del the field of "extra_specs",
there is something wrong occur. we could do the update.

Change-Id: I48c73076f30e068a1ee9dc8730eacbd34f30547e

commit_message:
[install] Update unset environment variable step

- Fix the incorrect environment variable.
  'OS_URL' should be 'OS_AUTH_URL'.

- Add another should be unset environment variable.
  And it will not require you input password after running the
  command until you unset the 'OS_PASSWORD'.

Change-Id: Ice02b301e03c06da9fdb26b3bfcb3fd4d8be1fcb
Closes-Bug: #1632992

commit_message:
Document and be more explicit in normalization

Put extra keys in both the root resource and in a properties dict.

Ensure data types are correct. Make sure int, float and bool values
are returned as int and bool.

Change disabled in flavor to is_disabled for consistency with other
bools we've added. There has been no release with the addition of disabled,
so changing it now is still safe.

Add locations and direct_url to images. They're optional in glance, but
that's evil.

Let image schema attribute fall through to extra properties.

Add zone to current_location.

Add readable mappings for power_state, task_state, vm_state, launched_at
and terminated_at for Servers. Also add a non-camel-cased host_id.

This is a big patch, but it's mostly just reorganizing and adding docs.
Looking at the changes to the tests and seeing that the only change is
adding zone and properties into a couple of fixtures is a good place to
start.

Change-Id: If5674c049c8dd85ca0b3483b7c2dc82b9e139bd6

commit_message:
Add devstack plugin execution to the Keystone v3 functional gate

The devstack plugin will live in the Keystone tree and will set
up the environment for our functional tests.

Only adding to the v3 gate for now, since that one is non-voting.

Depends-On: I820ae355ae8f3183fee2b8207e3c17e8bd10dc17

Change-Id: Ibccd2a080a6adc729a83d072de615f95a749efb3

commit_message:
Optimize command job-binary-download

The command "dataprocessing job binary download" should raise exception
directly if file exists.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-10 08:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/zuul_swift_upload.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/ef04d7b0477788cc565650f27bec648b97553dfb', 'message': "Make zuul_swift_upload.py more accurate for mime type detection

When a text file is quite generic like a .css or .js file
libmagic will detect the file's content as text/plain. This
patch adds a check of the mime database in order to guess the

Change-Id: Ic73332533fc4d6c1a89ccbdb59d44f3697c56dc0
"}]
commit_message:
Make zuul_swift_upload.py more accurate for mime type detection

When a text file is quite generic like a .css or .js file
libmagic will detect the file's content as text/plain. This
patch adds a check of the mime database in order to guess the
mime type given a file extension. This is only done
if text/plain is detected by libmagic.

Change-Id: Ic73332533fc4d6c1a89ccbdb59d44f3697c56dc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/78/328178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mimetypes mime = magic.from_file(file_path, mime=True) mime = m.file(file_path).split(';')[0] # libmagic can fail to detect the right mime type when content # is too generic. The case for css or js files. So in case # text/plain is detected then we rely on the mimetype db # to guess by file extension. if mime == 'text/plain': mime_guess = mimetypes.guess_type(file_path)[0] mime = mime_guess if mime_guess else mime return mime

commit_message:
networking-bgpvpn: add check-requirements jobs

The job was disabled at a time when the project was doing
released delayed with Openstack releases.

It can be re-enabled now.

(This reverts commit b8c4f8abfe5f69924ce804d5ed7a271e8d1fe9b5)

Change-Id: I80a81edee14479ec55bec568dde993e73e2e0dd8

commit_message:
Fix path issue in gate-dib-dsvm-functests

We recently added bindep support to diskimage-builder, in doing so, we
incorrectly looked in the wrong directory for the cloned project.

Change-Id: I960a466351dabae1b75c2f31183fcdb7c43fe173
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[config-ref] cleanup Lenovo volume driver

Change-Id: I41a48c1cfd33824de3c87a107b44943c7fc9d1b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/60/391860/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Lenovo S3200 or S2200 array with: - iSCSI or FC host interfaces - G22x firmware or later - Network connectivity between the OpenStack host and the array management interfaces - HTTPS or HTTP must be enabled on the array- Create, delete, attach, and detach volumes. - Create, list, and delete volume snapshots. - Create a volume from a snapshot. - Copy an image to a volume. - Copy a volume to an image. - Clone a volume. - Extend a volume. - Migrate a volume with back-end assistance. - Retype a volume. - Manage and unmanage a volume. $ openstack volume type create lenovo $ openstack volume type set --property volume_backend_name=lenovo-array lenovo
deleted_lines: - Lenovo S3200 or S2200 array with: - iSCSI or FC host interfaces - G22x firmware or later - Network connectivity between the OpenStack host and the array management interfaces - HTTPS or HTTP must be enabled on the array- Create, delete, attach, and detach volumes. - Create, list, and delete volume snapshots. - Create a volume from a snapshot. - Copy an image to a volume. - Copy a volume to an image. - Clone a volume. - Extend a volume. - Migrate a volume with back-end assistance. - Retype a volume. - Manage and unmanage a volume. $ cinder type-create lenovo $ cinder type-key lenovo set volume_backend_name=lenovo-array

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I815cc67860d4d858d2f17e273ec27a498e11af2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/syntribos refs/changes/19/391719/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exclude=.venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*lib/python*,*egg,build

commit_message:
Merge nova and neutron normalize methods

In keeping with the other normalize methods, combine these two into a
single normalize method.

Removed a unittest that did literally nothing but was mocking out things
at a crazy level. Remind me that we should REALLY stop mocking out
anything other than the requests calls.

Depends-On: I59e9834d249ccda0beeb715a8d6271140fb144f4
Change-Id: I077f9d8c4d250d180dec9ce4aabc8f64b507b05f

commit_message:
Add structure for Devstack plugin

This review creates the structure for the Devstack plugin and
prints to the console to ensure its execution in the gate.

Follow-up reviews will do more useful stuff like setting up
the environment for our functional testing (ldap, federation).

Change-Id: I820ae355ae8f3183fee2b8207e3c17e8bd10dc17

requests.

commit_message:
rename the option scheduler_default_filters

The value of "scheduler_default_filters" is what filters are really
used by users and it is not the default one, which is misleading.

Change-Id: If3bf379c6111e7d0d4f0f49adfa6b0b48c638697
Closes-Bug:#1449934

added_lines: class cached_property(property): def __init__(self, fn): self.__name__ = fn.__name__ self.__module__ = fn.__module__ self.__doc__ = fn.__doc__ self._fn = fn def __set__(self, obj, value): obj_vars = vars(obj) obj_vars[self.__name__] = value def __get__(self, obj, type=None): if obj is None: return self obj_vars = vars(obj) try: return obj_vars[self.__name__] except KeyError: value = self._fn(obj) obj_vars[self.__name__] = value return value

commit_message:
Remove cells.driver configuration option

The cells.driver configuration option was deprecated and
is now being removed in the Ocata cycle.

Change-Id: I881a5b6c09f4061d73f6007e08515f400ff8e72c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/65/390165/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add enable_proxy_headers_parsing option

The patch enables paste middleware to handle SSL requests through
HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware.

Change-Id: Iff08aa323fa63978ec8666610f197fa6038a2c28
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vitrage refs/changes/50/391450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add support for db_max_retries param
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 15:06:16.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/vitrage_db_spec.rb', 'manifests/db.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vitrage/commit/5542e5ad92b67f10b6c3a78dab079a2884e308c0', 'message': 'Add support for db_max_retries param

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection

Change-Id: Ibe03fcbf2cec154ae51753fb916705b8b5dcad4d
Closes-Bug: 1579718
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for db_max_retries param

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

Change-Id: Ibe03fcbf2cec154ae51753fb916705b8b5dcad4d
Closes-Bug: 1579718
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vitrage refs/changes/29/391229/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*database_db_max_retries*] # (optional) Maximum retries in case of connection error or deadlock error # before error is raised. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $database_db_max_retries = $::os_service_default, db_max_retries => $database_db_max_retries,

commit_message:
Constraints are ready to be used for tox.ini

Per email[1] from Andreas, we don't need to hack at install_command
any longer.

[1] http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/a4l7tokbotwqvuoh

Change-Id: I581cd94dd794ffb4d366a155e6d2bd8784809dd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/41/386541/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Update .coveragerc after the removal of openstack directory

The openstack directory was used to keep codes from oslo-incubator,
we have retired oslo-incubator,so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: I6a55ba5c98aed00935e0de028156a5dbb939f43f
